title: Network and Computer Systems Administrator, Jr
description:
Position: Network and Systems Administrator, Jr



Location: Fully Remote



We are seeking an inquisitive and aspiring individual to join our team as a Junior Network and Computer System Administrator. In this role, you'll be providing support for our Azure cloud network infrastructure and computer systems to ensure they are operating efficiently and securely.


Responsibilities:


* Install, configure, and maintain network hardware and software using Microsoft Azure Cloud. Work towards automating the process using PowerShell or Python
* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise
* Set up and maintain user accounts and permissions
* Provide user support for employee laptops and various software applications
* Implement security measures to protect the network and computer systems
* Perform regular backups and ensure data integrity
* Review security audit logs
* Respond to client system security questionnaires
* Collaborate with other IT team members to implement new technologies and projects
* Stay current on industry trends and best practices in network administration


Minimum Qualifications:


* Either
	+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
	+ Relevant certifications (e.g. CompTIA Network+, CCNA) and 2+ years of related experience
	+ 4+ years of related experience
* Strong understanding of network protocols and technologies
* Experience with configuring and managing network devices, such as routers, switches, and firewalls
* Knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


If you are a proactive individual with a passion for technology and a desire to grow in the field of network and computer system administration, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer transparent compensation and benefits, as well as opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.



Starting compensation for this position is $63,190.00/year + discretionary bonus dependent on the company performance.  

  

Benefits include:


* Unlimited Paid Time Off (25 days minimum)
* 9 Holidays
* Medical Insurance through Blue Cross Blue Shield
* Dental Insurance through Guardian
* Vision Insurance through VSP
* 401K through Slavic401K with 4% match and immediately vested
* Employer paid Short Term disability
* Employer paid Life and AD&D Insurance

title: Systems Administrator - IFS
description:
**Responsibilities:**

* Install, configure, and maintain IFS applications to meet business requirements.
* Implement and manage system configurations, including customization and integration with other enterprise systems.
* Monitor the performance of IFS applications, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions to optimize system performance.
* Conduct regular system health checks and proactively address potential issues.
* Provide technical support to end-users, addressing IFS-related queries and issues.
* Develop and deliver training programs for end-users and other IT staff to ensure proficient use of IFS applications.
* Implement and maintain security measures to protect IFS applications and data.
* Ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal security policies.
* Plan and execute upgrades and patches for IFS applications in coordination with stakeholders.
* Test and validate changes to ensure system stability after updates.
* Develop and maintain backup and recovery procedures for IFS applications and associated data.
* Perform regular backups and conduct recovery drills to ensure data integrity.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and other IT professionals.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide status updates.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field preferred
* **Experience with cloud versions of IFS is a MUST**
* Proven experience as a Systems Administrator on IFS applications.
* Hands-on experience with IFS version upgrades, patches, and system configurations.
* In-depth knowledge of IFS applications, modules, and associated technologies.
* Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server) supporting IFS.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration and user support.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $35.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* System administration/configuration: 3 years (Preferred)
* IFS Cloud: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Operations Systems Administrator 2
description:
**Overview:** This position is responsible for researching, evaluating, installing, operating and maintaining IT Infrastructure, enterprise applications and telecommunications systems. Advanced knowledge of IBM I and Windows Operating systems is required. Systems Operations experience including job monitoring and scheduling, access management and system maintenance are required. Must also be experienced with vendor and service provider management and ensuring proper delivery of the services. Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to managing project activities, analysis and remediation of security issues, execution of disaster recovery plans and availability for the execution of off-hours maintenance.

**Job Duties**

1. Administers and monitors Enterprise Applications as well as related infrastructure and systems required to maintain appropriate levels of performance and availability. Designs, develops, installs and tests application and Operating System upgrades, patches and enhancements.

2.Creates system documentation, including system configurations, operational procedures and training materials. Implements and maintains proper documentation, such as a runbook, of Production processes necessary to identify and escalate failures or degraded services.

3. Implements, maintains and monitors system schedules and processes, including those on IBM i and Windows servers.

4. Develops, deploys and maintains system to system communications and data exchange orchestration including related software, access control, logging, protocols, hardware and vendors.

5. Takes ownership of system problems by leveraging in-house tools, vendors and support organizations while communicating and coordinating with company staff and management. Provides user, business-partner and vendor support and also communicates and escalates issues according to established processes.

6. Performs technology reviews to ensure that systems, applications and services satisfy business requirements and resolves any identified deficiencies. Reviews and analyzes existing applications’ effectiveness and efficiency, and then develops strategies for improving or leveraging these systems and increase user adoption

7. Designs, implements, tests and executes backup and recovery routines and monitors and administers the related tools to ensure the Business Continuity requirements are satisfied.

8. Directly involved with the identification, negotiation and management of vendors, service providers and related contracts as well as budget planning. Assist with feasibility studies and proof of concept exercises for services, software and related products being considered.

9. Participates in the change management process by assessing, monitoring and executing changes and promotions

**Prerequisites for the Job**

* 3-5 years IT systems and application administration and support, with extensive experience implementing enterprise-class technology solutions.
* Advanced knowledge of IBM i operating system sufficient to install, configure, implement, and administer systems/applications loaded thereon.
* Minimum 2-3 years experience as a system operator .
* Experience with Microsoft Operating System administration
* Ability to analyze a concept and devise an implementation plan utilizing all resources both internal and external
* Proficiency in oral and written English language communication
* Willingness to work cooperatively with others
* Physical and mental requirements for General Personnel

title: Business Systems Administrator
description:
Do you love building new systems in a fast-paced, high-impact work environment? Are you driven to change the standard of care in women’s health?  

  

The Lactation Network is hiring a **Business Systems Administrator.** This person will be essential in the administration and maintenance of IT systems.  

  

We are a small, tight-knit, purpose-driven organization with aggressive growth goals in 2024 and beyond. We don’t have all the answers and we don’t expect you to, either. We do expect you to be curious, hardworking, and striving to be your best self.  

  

**Breakdown of the role*** **Systems Administration & Maintenance (40%).** Your primary responsibilities will be to configure system settings, conduct regular system maintenance and perform user management.
* **Business Analysis (30%).** This position will collaborate with business stakeholders to document business process and requirements.
* **Analytics & Reporting (30%).** You’ll configure and manage revenue cycle data dashboards, data exports and data reports.


  

**What you’ll do**  

Reporting to the Technical Lead, you will have responsibilities that include:* Serve as primary administrator for our various Healthcare revenue cycle systems.
* Configure systems to meet needs of business processes and customers.
* Audit user access to systems and ensure licenses are being used effectively.
* Perform routine maintenance and controlled updates to IT systems.
* Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to collect and document requirements and clarify business objectives.
* Create system documentation e.g. data flow diagrams, standard operating procedures, etc. Thoroughly test and deploy configuration updates to revenue cycle systems.
* Coordinate and assist with User Acceptance Testing.
* Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge bases.


  

**What we expect from you*** 3-5 years of experience as a Systems Administrator or similar role.
* 2+ years of experience with common enterprise system cloud-based platforms e.g., ERP, CRM, EMR, CMS, Netsuite
* Experience with relational databases, queries and extracts e.g. SQL
* Experience with data analysis, data visualization and dashboards.
* Experience gathering and documenting user requirements.
* A growth mindset
* A bias for action
* Close attention to detail
* Strong collaboration and communication skills
* High EQ
* The ability to inspire
* Poise under pressure
* A glass-half-full attitude

  

**What we’d also love to see*** Experience in high-growth organizations
* Health insurance billing and revenue cycle experience
* A Chicagoland home address (but we’ll consider remote candidates, too)
  

  

**What you can expect from us*** **Unlimited PTO.** We work hard. We’re passionate about what we’re building together. We also have lives outside work.
* **Healthcare benefits.** Medical plus voluntary vision, dental. (We are a healthcare company, after all.)
* **401(k) with 4% employer match.** We’re planning for the future—and we want to help you do the same.
* **Remote-first culture.** We are a distributed, remote-first team. We also like spending time together in our Chicago office and have a flexible in-office culture for those who wish to return to work in-person.
* **Mindfulness and Meditation App.** You’ll have complimentary access to the leading app for meditations, sleep stories, and other wellness resources.
* **Recharge.** We have one designated “no meeting day” each week so you can take a break from videoconferencing and have some quiet time to focus.
* **Professional development.** We invest in our team by offering every employee access to a professional development budget.
* **Competitive compensation.** We’re looking for top talent.
* **A growth environment.** The sky’s the limit.

  

**About Lactation Network**  

The Lactation Network is setting a new standard for parents and lactation consultants alike. At TLN, our movement goes beyond any single outlet or tool. We activate education, connection, and advocacy to foster the new network of inclusive care between parents and IBCLCs; the network where every caregiver has the resources to thrive. TLN is powered by the largest network of IBCLCs in the country. Together, we are here to make sure families get the expert insurance covered lactation care that they deserve.  

  

The Lactation Network is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Title - Systems Administrator** 

**W2 only**

**Location – Remote**

**Green Card/US Citizen** 

**Description:**

As a Systems Administrator you will work independently, with your peers, and with our software vendors to translate customer needs into technical solutions for our Finance and Actuarial team. You will be responsible for the control of the technical configuration of technical vendor assets (primarily focused on tax and GRC platforms) by applying processes for documentation, change control management, reconfiguration, baselining, data management, and other relevant processes. You will manage and modify the elements that comprise information produced as a part of the software vendor process. You will be responsible for understanding vendor capabilities to best leverage the technology we have to deliver on our business objectives. This includes understanding vendor upgrades for impacts, configuring the system to deliver value, and maintaining certificates.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

Technical Configuration

* Ability to support configuration via software and/or scripting
* Contributes to the design and configuration of systems
* Ability to do data analysis within the platform, as needed
* Ability to support reports and analytics
* Ability to work / problem solve collaboratively & independently
* Follow, maintain, and may create processes, procedures, and documentation
* Strong working knowledge of systems/platform configuration

**Managing Technology Vendors**

* Ability to understand a vendor platform to be able to support configuration via software and/or scripting
* Ability to identify vendor release impacts and support release validation
* Participate in proof of concept / technology with the vendor (ex SOW process)
* Ability to support user provisioning and user account management (systematic or manual)
* Works collaborative with technology vendors to address system/platform and business needs

**Collaborating within the team**

* Participate in and may lead teams collaboration session to provide technical expertise to solve problem/remove roadblock
* Participate in and may lead product and release planning to help decompose work

**Collaboration outside the team:**

* Networks outside of the team to grow skills
* Bring awareness to their role across key stakeholders
* Actively working to learn how their role fits within the larger Thrivent ecosystem
* Participates in team support rotation, if applicable

**Coaching Others**

* May provide guidance to junior team members to help them learn foundational configuration skills

**Building Talent**

* Seeks to grow themselves through experiences and learning opportunities and share back with the team when applicable
* Contributes to an environment in which Thrivent employees and colleagues are focused on continuous improvement, exceptional employee engagement, and an unwavering commitment to our clients.
* Shapes and supports a culture that represents the Thrivent purpose, promise, values, ensuring that Thrivent's trust and reputation remain strong with its clients
* Models Thrivent's Leadership Competencies

**Technical Acumen**

* May have understanding of basic principles of Dev Ops to be able to make recommendations / implement Dev Ops for vendor packages
* Understanding of basic engineering and/or software development principles and terminology
* Understanding of common IT controls and processes (change management etc.)
* Understanding of common operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.) and proficiency in at least one operating system
* Basic understanding of common technical protocols, constructs, and concepts including but not limited to: basic networking and networking protocols, servers, storage, databases, application hosting platforms, cloud computing, and common application development tooling
* Understanding and familiarity of common security concepts, practices, and tools

**General**

* Understand and apply system & platform policies, standards, and processes to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability to Thrivent
* Assess and interpret policies and procedures and relevant business and technology processes
* Identify and recommend process improvements to streamline and enhance technology solutions
* Understand potential technology risks and respond appropriately
* Provide assistance with other deployed technologies, as needed
* Support regulatory examinations and internal audits, as needed
* Provide on call support of deployed technologies, as needed

**Required:**

* Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) platform support
* Server Configuration - Linux and Windows
* Security configuration and identify management integration
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in computer science, information security, business, mathematics or related field
* 3+ years of applicable experience
* Demonstrated leadership on small-mid scale projects impacting strategic priorities

Preferred:

* SAI Bwise, ServiceNow GRC platform and administration experience
* Strong Knowledge of Networking Protocols, Single Sign On, entitlement provisioning, and virtualization technologies.
* Test Data Maintenance and masking knowledge
* Diagnose, troubleshoot & perform repairs on responsible technologies
* Knowledge and proficient in the following technologies a plus: Java, mainframe

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

Work Location: Remote

title: Linux Administrator -Bare Metal server
description:
**Job Title: Sr Linux Admin Bare Metal**

**Location: Remote**

**Duration: Full Time**

**They want Sr Linux Admin with Bare Metal server exp and strong scripting skills. Some Bare metal work/tools are DHCP and PXE.**  **should have 10+ years of experience.** 

**strong Linux, bare metal, Scripting, CI/CD (Jenkins)** 

Senior System Administrator – Production Systems Integration

JOB DESCRIPTION: Primary focus for the position is on replacement and divestiture of end-of-support hardware and software solutions within the production environment. Secondary responsibilities include ay-to-day maintenance and support of Linux production, QA, development, and infrastructure environments. Deploy, configure, harden, and manage systems across business unit platforms utilizing automation tools. Manage platform security, user provisioning, filesystem permissions, and privilege escalation for authorized personnel in all environments. Work with Security group to identify and remediate short and long-term security concerns, including (but not limited to) scheduled and emergency system patching and perform system-level audits and investigations. Manage disaster recovery platforms and minimize failed system recovery time and replacement in datacenters as necessary. Provide strong contributions to tactical and strategic system design and architecture for both business and internal project initiatives.

Collaborate with software developers to review technology requirements to ensure the compatibility of system components as well as contribute to development and deployment efforts to provide modular, scalable and sustainable solutions that meet/exceed requirements, business objectives and goals.

Create and maintain system engineering and architectural documentation published via Wiki.

Develop and utilize models and simulations, using manual or automated tools/test harnesses to analyze, characterize and predict system performance under different operating conditions and loads.

Work directly with vendor engineering support channels to identify, diagnose, and remediate operational issues (both software and hardware in nature) as encountered.

Make recommendations and implement appropriate automation solutions to streamline processes while reducing opportunity for human error and improving delivery times.

Demonstrates proficiency at documentation, turnover, and education regarding build platform architecture on an ever evolving basis

1.Systems Architecture

**Develop and deploy automation, monitoring and software solutions** to be utilized by the team. Remain conceptually aware of emerging technologies and present meaningful updates to the team regarding them.

2. Systems Engineering

**Daily monitoring and maintenance of all Linux system platforms, incident investigation and troubleshooting, new system testing and deployment/decommissioning, hardware and software performance evaluation and documentation.**

3.Incident Management

Creates and/or updates incident records for determining RCA in the production Linux systems environments and initiates and drives vendor resolution as applicable.

4.Level 2/3 Production Support

Provides Level 2 or Level 3 support to Systems Operations regarding network connectivity issues or server/network related hardware issues.

MUST-HAVES:

Capable of independent work effort and delivery while actively collaborating with internal and external technical resources

Minimum of 10+ years professional experience in Linux systems administration in a production environment

**Shell scripting and process automation experience.**

Familiarity with available open-source solutions for platform management, automation, and deployment

Production-focused mindset with the ability to effectively manage time and prioritize based on knowledge of business criticality

Clearly articulated and verifiable work history in challenging, growth-oriented environments

Ability to remain flexible with after hours and weekend work / troubleshooting

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience

NICE-TO-HAVES:

Prior work experience in financial or real-time computing sectors

Python scripting knowledge and hands-on experience

Container based platform knowledge in kubernetes or OpenShift

Familiarity with day-to-day administration and platform management of enterprise backup solutions

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 11+ years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Linux: 10 years (Required)
* Bare Metal server: 9 years (Required)
* Physical server: 6 years (Required)
* DHCP /PXE: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Project Administrator
description:
Job Description


We are seeking a highly motivated Information Technology (IT) Project Administrator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of project planning principles and practices, as well as experience with Microsoft Project, Excel, and SharePoint in a DoD IT environment. The candidate will be responsible for managing schedules for multiple projects, creating and modifying existing project schedules, serving as project coordinator, scheduling meetings and recording meeting minutes for later reference, coordinating guidance development efforts with Government customer and external vendors, assisting with deliverables, tracking and reporting on deliverable items, and collecting data for status reports.


Key Tasks and Responsibilities


* Manages schedules for multiple projects.


* Creates and modifies existing project schedules as needed.


* Serves as project coordinator, schedules meetings and records meeting minutes for later reference.


* Coordinates guidance development efforts with Government customer and external vendors.


* Assists with contract deliverables.


* Tracks and reports on deliverable items and collects data from Project Managers for monthly and quarterly status reports.


* Creates and updates process documentation and templates.


* Supports program task execution and performs other duties as assigned.



Job Requirements:



Education & Experience


* Experience with MS Project (required).


* Experience with SharePoint, Excel, and other MS Office products (required).


* Experience working in an IT environment (highly desired).


* Good organization skills with ability to streamline processes and procedures.


* Ability to work as a team player and take initiative on tasks.


Certifications


* None


Security Clearance


* DoD Interim Secret / Final Secret clearance is required


Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.)


* Remote work may be authorized

title: System Administrator - Seventy-Five Percent Travel Required
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

We are seeking a skilled and experienced System Administrator to join our IT team. This role is unique in that it involves heavy travel, as our projects span various locations and require on-site support. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to adapt to different environments.


**What You'll Be Doing:**

* Provide on-site system administration and support for clients across multiple locations.
* Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software components of IT systems.
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network issues in a timely manner.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their IT needs and tailor solutions accordingly.
* Manage and maintain documentation related to system configurations, processes, and procedures.
* Collaborate with remote and on-site teams to address IT challenges and implement improvements.

**What Required Skills You'll Bring:**

* Proven experience as a System Administrator or similar role.
* In-depth knowledge of operating systems, network protocols, and system security.
* Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to analyze and resolve complex issues.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Willingness to travel extensively to client sites (up to 75% travel). Travel is three weeks out of the month within the United States.  
* 

  

**What Desired Skills You'll Bring:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Relevant certifications such as CompTIA Security+, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA), or equivalent.
* Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V).
* Experience with Building Automation and Control Systems is a plus
* Experience with DoD Systems is a plus
* DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 certifications minimum, Level 3 preferred.

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None
This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.
Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.
Salary Range:


$46.35 - $81.11
We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!
The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.


This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will continue to be posted for an average of 30 days until a qualified applicant is selected or the position has been cancelled.
Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

title: Linux Systems Administrator
description:
**WHAT WE WANT**

FriendFinder Networks is looking for a Linux Systems Administrator who will be responsible for availability, installation, configuration, provisioning, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software. You will respond to trouble tickets created by the NOC, monitor automations and internal customers; install new servers, rebuild existing servers, and configure hardware, peripherals, services, and settings in accordance with operational requirements. You have to document, update and maintain installation and configuration procedures on the Wiki, and will contribute and maintain best practices documentation for operations, security, and capital efficiency. Your contributions will ensure our systems will provide our customers the best possible user experience for everyone who visits our web sites 24 hours a day, every day of the year, all over the world.

**WHAT YOU WILL DO**

* Ensure proper security, monitoring, alerting and reporting for the infrastructure
* Work with the NOC and DC Tech teams, using Tivoli monitoring and other tools to ensure the integrity and availability of our hardware, server resources, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups
* Work with the incident team to diagnose and recover from hardware or software failures working with or as the Incident Commander to coordinate and communicate with our internal customers
* Assist project teams with technical issues in the planning phase of sites or project development efforts
* Gather system requirements and support several project teams in evolving, testing and rolling-out new products and services, then transitioning the site or product to post launch operations activities throughout life of the product or service
* Work with the R&D team and other systems engineers to make improvements
* Document processes and procedures and follow a formal change management procedure

**WHAT YOU MUST HAVE**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or equivalent work experience
* 5+ years’ experience administering Linux required or equivalent work experience
* Experience with Apache, nginx, lighttpd, and high volume web servers
* Experience with high volume mail servers
* Experience with monitoring tools, e.g. nagios, cacti
* Experience with kickstart or jumpstart maintenance and implementation
* Experience with load balancers
* Experience in analysis and system performance tuning
* Experience in Perl or Shell Scripting, with experience implementing automation and monitoring using shell scripting and other related tools
* Experience with proxies / reverse proxies, e.g. ha-proxy, squid, varnish
* You must be comfortable with adult content
* You must be at least 21 years old

**WHAT IS PREFERABLE TO HAVE**

* Knowledge of protocols such as DNS, HTTP, SMTP, SNMP
* Knowledge of OSI model
* Knowledge of the challenges in a very large multifaceted global environment
* Comfortable with new technologies such as containers/Docker and container orchestration such as Kubernetes
* Ability to implement automation and monitoring using shell scripting and other related tools, Puppet

**WHAT YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO DEMONSTRATE**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Critical thinking skills in a complex IT environment to analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve problems without direction
* Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
* High degree of honesty and integrity
* Team-player, positive attitude and flexible

**REPORTING TO THIS POSITION:** No direct reports

**PERKS**

FriendFinder Networks Inc. and its subsidiaries offer a business casual work environment, flexible work hours, and a competitive salary. The benefits package includes:

* 401(k) with a 6% match on eligible earnings with no vesting period
* Medical (Kaiser HMO, Blue Cross PPO), Dental, and Vision
* Flexible Spending Account for Healthcare and Dependent Care
* Life Insurance, AD&D, LTD and Short and Long Term Disability
* Paid Time Off (20 days PTO) and Holiday Pay (12 company paid holidays off)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Commuter Benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Health Club Reimbursement

**WE ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT WE DO**

Not only do we love what we do, but we truly believe in it. We grow through positive education, skill training, courses, big stories, and big dreams. We are constantly improving and striving for perfection to revolutionize and enhance the lives of our members.

**WE CARE ABOUT PEOPLE**

The main precondition of any relationship is the ability to put ourselves in someone else’s shoes to truly understand them. Satisfied customers, employees, and business partners are not just a cog in the wheel, but the main ingredient of the company’s success.

**WE EMBRACE DIVERSITY IN ALL FORMS**

FriendFinder Networks has embraced diversity from the beginning of its history dating back to the mid 1990s. We created the first online personals sites for gays and lesbians, for non-English-speaking audiences, and for those who enjoy what was once called "alternative lifestyles". Headquartered in San Francisco / Silicon Valley and staffed throughout the world, our team also relies on diversity of background, perspectives, and ideas.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $115,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

Experience:

* Linux: 5 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 2 years (Preferred)
* Ansible: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Summary:** Under general supervision and with independent judgment, develops and maintains large computer applications/systems, including enterprise applications. Ensures assigned systems are working properly, evaluates application/system performance to maintain standards, investigates and resolves complex software and hardware problems of users by performing the following duties.
  
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

1. Following defined processes, performs daily monitoring of applications/systems and enterprise systems (such as Active Directory, Imaging, E-mail, Thunderhead, Guidewire, and Peoplesoft), verifying the integrity and availability of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure.
  
  

a. Installs, updates, configures and monitors application/systems, working with other IT teams to ensure appropriate groups and security rights exist
  
b. Ensures enterprise consistency and integration where appropriate
  
c. Using problem management procedures, investigates and resolves software and hardware problems, handling problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution and follow-up
  
d. Coordinates and manages scheduled maintenance and unscheduled outages
  
e. Prepares standard statistical reports
  
f. Creates application documentation as necessary
  
  

2. Ensures timely resolution of problem issues in accordance with customer expectations and procedural documentation.
  
a. Provides support and assistance to peers during problem resolutions situations, at times after normal business hours
  
b. Leads crisis calls and coordinates efforts with other IT groups
  
c. Provides status updates to users, supervisors, and management regarding problem resolution efforts.
  
d. Documents all solutions and communications
  
e. Works with vendors to resolve hardware and software issues while keeping supervisor and other Help Desk staff informed on progress
  
  

3. Acts as liaison between IT and business units for assigned applications/systems.
  
a. Provides technical direction to business units
  
b. May coordinate and execute basic training for new employees on computer hardware, software, and security.
  
c. Works with appropriate IT groups to meet business unit needs
  
  

4. Responsible for maintaining application licensing compliance.
  
a. Coordinates licensing programs with vendors
  
b. Prepares budget information
  
  

5. Develops defined processes for application support, using standard template
  
a. Ensures process are maintained and updated
  
  

6. Serves as a contributing member of project teams, or leader of project teams, coordinating resources to ensure achievement of project activities.
  
  

7. Perform other duties as assigned.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

**Education/Experience:**  

**Level 5:** Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university; or four to six years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  
  

A minimum requirement for this position is the ability to work legally in the United States. No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

title: Application System Administrator
description:
**Our Purpose**

Bringing Friends and Families Together, Over Delicious Food, Served From the Heart

**Our Mission**

· Build an Amazing Workplace

· Create Customers for Life

· Become Franchisor of Choice

**Position Overview**

The Application System Administrator will lead, manage, and support critical business applications to ensure good performance, research, and resolve production issues including working with the application vendors technical support as needed. This role will have responsibility for multiple store operational systems including CrunchTime back-office software, online ordering and 3rd party delivery systems that support our restaurant operation’s needs. This role will interact daily with internal customers to make sure their needs are being met.

The Application System Administrator will also be responsible for documenting system configurations, job processes, program modifications and system procedures across all systems. Additionally, the Application System Administrator will lead new software installations, system testing, configuration changes and updates, as well as a variety of application troubleshooting. This role will report to the Director, Restaurant Technology.

**Responsibilities Include:**

· Perform configuration, administration, deployment, integration, and tuning of software application systems

· Perform assessment of product enhancements and determine the benefit and impact of vendor changes to the software products

· Document procedures for resolving issues in the most efficient way

· Make recommendations to department and operations leadership on process improvement and effective use of the products by operations

· Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance on software application-related issues

· Coordinate with customers and application vendors on technical issues, estimate time to resolution and provide updates to concerned parties during issue resolution

· Communicate effectively with customers on problems and resolution steps and status

· Open and/or close work orders as needed

· Maintain system security (user accounts, responsibilities, passwords, etc…)

· Assist quality assurance in validating changes and perform testing as needed

· Responsible for maintaining quality standards on all projects

· Have a high level of computer security awareness

· Other duties, as assigned

**Qualifications and Skills:**

· Ability to think independently, negotiate with grace and stay focused

· Capacity to communicate clearly with presence

· Strong verbal and written communication skills are mandatory

· Flexibility in the face of shifting priorities

· Ability to prioritize, manage, and complete multiple tasks/projects

· Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

**Education and Experience**

· Associate’s or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

· 3-5 years of experience successfully supporting business applications, to include end user support, administration, maintenance, and upgrades

· Knowledge and experience with POS and back-office software, online ordering, and 3rd party delivery systems

· Solid understanding of core Microsoft technologies

· Working knowledge of restaurant operations

**Preferred Experience**

· Experience with restaurant back-office systems such as CrunchTime or Altametrics eRestaurant

· Knowledge and experience with MS SQL Server

**Disclaimer**

This position description is not intended, and should not be considered to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, effort or working conditions associated with the job. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of those principal job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, personal development, and compensation.

title: IT Helpdesk Specialist
description:
Small Door is membership-based veterinary care designed with human standards that is better for pets, pet parents, and veterinarians alike. We designed and delivered a reimagined veterinary experience via a membership that includes exceptional care, 24/7 telemedicine, and transparent pricing - delivered with modern hospitality in spaces designed by animal experts to be stress-free. We opened our flagship location in Manhattan's West Village in 2020 and have quickly expanded across the East Coast. Small Door now operates in New York City, Boston, Washington DC, and Maryland with continued expansion plans in 2024.


Small Door is looking for an IT enthusiast who takes pride in delivering outstanding support to end users, thrives on solving complex technical issues, and is passionate about staying updated with the latest technology trends. You will work closely with our Product & Technology team as well as our People operations team to ensure that we are providing strong experiences for all of our employees.


**What you'll do:**


* Provide comprehensive support to end-users, addressing both hardware and software issues to ensure seamless operations and minimal downtime
* Participate in the configuration of network, printers, and software systems for new branches prior to their opening, facilitating a smooth commencement of operations
* Lead and organize comprehensive IT Onboarding sessions for new hires, ensuring they are equipped with necessary systems knowledge for their roles
* Act as a cornerstone in the day-to-day operations of our IT networks, contributing to the efficient running of the business
* Work hand-in-hand with the IT Manager on various IT projects & initiatives, bringing your unique insights to the table
* Methodically document technical issues, resolutions, and processes to foster knowledge sharing and future reference
* Collaborate with vendors to procure necessary equipment for new and existing employees as required, ensuring timely delivery and setup
* Assist in maintaining and administering our physical security systems, such as Verkada, Brivo, and Eagle Eye Networks, contributing to a secure work environment
* Coordinate hardware returns and repairs, ensuring equipment is operational and in top condition


**What you'll need:**


* Proficient in supporting both MacOS & Windows operating systems
* Practical experience with Google Workspace, Okta, Mosyle, Slack, Zoom, and Notion, showcasing familiarity with popular workplace platforms
* Proficient with various IT Helpdesk services
* At least 2 years of experience in IT operations
* An exceptional communicator, with strong interpersonal skills to effectively assist end users with technical issues
* Strong at troubleshooting and problem-solving skills that translate into quick and efficient resolutions


**What you'll get:**


* Competitive salary
* Equity ownership
* Health, dental + vision insurance
* 401K (plus 4% company match)
* Upward mobility and growth opportunities
* Generous paid-time off, parental leave, and company wide holidays
* One Medical membership, Commuter benefits, Carrot Fertility benefits, Monthly Health & Wellness stipend
* Discounted veterinary care for your loved ones
* Growth opportunities
* An opportunity to make a real impact on the people around you
* A collaborative group of people who live our core values and have your back

  



#LI-hybrid

 **New York Pay Range**


$60,000—$80,000 USD
Small Door is proudly a public benefit corporation and a certified B Corp. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, and we encourage qualified applicants of every background, ability, and life experience to apply to appropriate employment opportunities.

title: Systems Administrator, Volunteer
description:
**Systems Administrators, Volunteer**

**About the Pet Cancer Foundation**

The Pet Cancer Foundation’s vision is to increase the life expectancy and improve the quality of life of pets diagnosed with cancer. Estimates suggest the number of dogs and cats developing cancer every year is 12 million; roughly 6x the number of humans getting cancer yearly within North America.

As the organization continues to work towards the accomplishment of our mission, the PCF team includes professionals contributing virtually across Canada, the United States, and several other countries worldwide. As we grow and require technological solutions to support our many efforts, we're in need of experienced Systems Administrators to join our team. That’s where and how you can help us.

**About the Position**

We are looking for volunteer **Systems Administrators** eager to use and grow their technological skills for an organization setting out to be a leader in our field. In this role, the successful individual will protect our critical information, systems, and assets, build solutions, implement new software, provide training, and assist in the development of an overall IT strategy. From early on, you’ll help empower our breakthrough innovations, be given challenging assignments, lead initiatives, and take ownership and responsibility. Our ideal candidate will be passionate about applying their skills to technology-based business model that creates real-world solutions for the Foundation.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Provide vision and strategy to ensure that the platform is equipped to keep pace with the modern technologies and techniques
* Providing ongoing assessment, analysis, and continuous improvement to the technological tools to elevate program effectiveness and efficiencies towards user goals
* Day-to-day activities include working with user teams to train and supporting the use of technological environment
* Maintain essential IT operations, including communication and collaborations tools, applications, email systems and software
* Install and configure software
* Create and maintain technical and process documentation
* Set up accounts in the different tools and systems used by the Foundation
* Upgrade systems with new releases and models.
* Perform cloud administration tasks, including user/group administration, security permissions, group policies and resource monitoring, ensuring system architecture components work together seamlessly
* Interact with the help desk and other teams to assist in troubleshooting, identify root cause, and provide technical support when needed

**About You:**

You are a passionate technologist who takes great pride in working with organizations to deliver and support software solutions that assist the organization in pursuit of their strategic vision. Your high attention-to-detail informs your efforts to deliver quality in the projects you work on. You have:

* Bachelor’s degree in technology or computer science.
* Proven work experience in IT.
* Experience with or knowledge of programming languages and operating systems; current equipment and technologies, enterprise backup and recovery procedures, system performance-monitoring tools, communication, and collaboration tolls (Slack, Jira, Trello, and others).
* Excellent communication skills.
* Experience working in a research environment that relies extensively on Open-Source solutions.
* Confidence in proposing new ideas, using analytical skills, presenting to key stakeholders, and receiving feedback is important.
* Experience in project management, application design and integration, and cloud computing.

**What we provide you with**

This is an amazing role for anyone who is looking to either go into private or non-profit sectors. You will develop excellent networking and strategy skills and will continue to keep current knowledge of the latest industry trends and developments.

**Footnotes**

* This position works virtually from anywhere in the United States or Canada.
* Expectations regarding a time commitment are in the range of 4-6 hours per week on average.
* Additional time and flexibility may be necessary at times, and your flexibility to adapt is an attribute we seek.
* Please visit our website at www.petcancerfdn.org for more information about the organization

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 4 – 6 per week

Application Question(s):

* Please note that Indeed sometimes adds a "suggested salary" for all roles when the posting does not include a salary. Because this is a volunteer role, we do not include a salary om our posting.

To avoid misunderstanding, we ask that you leave us a brief note acknowledging your awareness and willingness to volunteer so we can properly consider your application. Thank you!

* Please describe your previous experience as a Systems Administrator, including any specific technologies, systems, or tools you have worked with.
* The Pet Cancer Foundation aims to make a significant impact in the fight against pet cancer. What motivates you to volunteer for our cause, and how do you see your role as a Systems Administrator contributing to our mission?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Technical support: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Recruiting Specialist
description:

Centuria Corporation is seeking a IT Recruiting Specialist to support our Service Delivery team.
Centuria, a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), has been delivering IT, Engineering, and Scientific solutions to the Federal Government since 2002. title: Part-Time Cloud/Linux Administrator

To check your status please use this link and enter your address: https://maps.certify.sba.gov/hubzone/map#center=44.722800,-103.249700&zoom=4

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description:
FEDITC, LLC is a fast-growing business supporting DoD and other intelligence agencies worldwide. FEDITC develops mission-critical national security systems worldwide, directly supporting the Warfighter, DoD Leadership, & the country. We are proud & honored to provide these services.

**Overview of position:**


FEDITC is seeking a remote Senior Systems Administrator (Server/Citrix). Active Secret Clearance and a United States Citizenship are required to be considered for this position.

  



**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for overall Citrix planning, design, administration and engineering. Requires proficiency in several disciplines. The candidate will be required to support a multi-server environment with both physical and virtual servers. The Citrix Engineer will be required to work with Citrix core technologies in a military environment. The successful candidate must have enterprise level Citrix infrastructures including:
	+ Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops (Ideally at least ver. 1912 LTSR CU2)
	+ Storefront Server
	+ Citrix User Profile Manager
	+ Citrix Machine Creation Services
	+ Citrix Director
	+ Citrix Studio
	+ Citrix NetScaler ADC
	+ Citrix ADM
	+ + Security Engineering
* The Systems Administrator (Citrix) will perform daily administrative tasks on the infrastructure as well as work on projects and provide end user support when required. This individual will be required to maintain and continually improve the environment to provide the highest levels of service to the user base.
* Assess performance of systems and adjust, capacity planning and growth projections, assist with end-user support, and perform software installs, patching and system upgrades.
* Responsible to maintain, upgrade and manage military business applications, software, hardware, and networks.
* Your goal will be to ensure that our technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.
	+ Responsibilities include:
	+ Install and configure software and hardware
	+ Manage network servers and technology tools
	+ Set up accounts and workstations
	+ Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
	+ Troubleshoot issues and outages
	+ Ensure security through access controls, backups and firewalls
	+ Upgrade systems with new releases and models
	+ Develop expertise to train staff on new technologies
	+ Build an internal wiki with technical documentation, manuals and IT policies
	+ Security Engineering background is a plus

**Required Skills / Qualifications**

* We support this client from 8 AM - 5 PM EST. However, if required this individual will be required to maintain the operation of various sites. Business operation demands 24/7/365 continuous up time so candidate must be able to work extra hours when needed which may include holidays and weekends. Continuously changing software and hardware platforms require ongoing training and self-directed learning to maintain skill set. Based on the functions of the Citrix Administrator position the candidate will have Admin level rights and access to sensitive and confidential information and must exercise discretion and always maintain confidentiality
* Candidate should already have a CAC or just recently leaving an assignment where a CAC was necessary.
* Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should also have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users.

 **Education:**

* . BS/BA degree in IT, Computer Science, or similar, or commensurate experience.

 **Certifications:**

* CompTIA Security+

 **Clearance:**

* Must be a US Citizen and an Active Secret Clearance.
* Maintain applicable security clearance(s) at the level required by the client and/or applicable certification(s) as requested by FEDITC and/or required by FEDITC’S Client(s)/Customer(s)/Prime contractor(s).

 *FEDITC, LLC. is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. We do not employ AI tools in our decision-making processes. Regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran, FEDITC, LLC. ensures that all employment decisions are made in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Our commitment to non-discrimination in employment extends to every location in which our company operates.*

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Job Description:**
The Wisemen team is seeking a skilled Systems Administrator to join our Contact Center Support team. Our team supports the management of the largest private, secured civilian government toll-free telephony infrastructure in the United States.  


The Systems Administrator performs administrative functions to support the operation of the 30+ IRS contact centers, with a focus on managing the inventory and distribution of agent hardware devices to the 18,000 + users.
  

  

**Will perform a range of analytical studies and projects affecting major agency program operations including:*** Analyzes requirements to develop reporting systems, data gathering and analytical techniques, and systems evaluation methodologies.
* Using quantitative and qualitative techniques, analyzes and evaluates the effectiveness of program operations and systems and makes recommendations or modifications to correct any deficiencies.
* Compiles, reconciles, correlates, and summarizes narrative information and quantitative data.
* Develops procedures and systems for establishing, evaluating, and assessing the effectiveness of program operations.
* Develops detailed plans, goals, and objectives for the long-range implementation and administration of program activity.
* As needed, the incumbent is responsible for coordinating with other Business Units (BUs) service-wide to develop guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) relative to the function.
* Additionally, the incumbent will coordinate, when appropriate, with other units to develop individual sections of the Internal Revenue Manual (IRM).
* Performs other duties as assigned.

 **Skills/Experience Level:**  

Junior to Mid-Level  

**Basic Qualifications:*** Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience with a bachelor’s degree.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in an administrative capacity.
* 3-5 years’ experience in the contact center technology domain.
* Must have familiarity with contact center concepts, terminology, and technologies.
* Skills and experience with Microsoft Office products specifically MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio.
* Able to obtain and maintain a Moderate Risk Background Investigation (MBI) security clearance,
* Must be a US Citizen.
* Hybrid - Candidate must live within 2 hours from a government facility.

  

  

  

**About Wisemen Multimedia, LLC:**  

  

Founded in 2010, we are a minority owned, HUBZone certified, small business concern and GSA Schedule holder, based in Atlanta, GA. As an enterprise solutions provider, we offer a wide range of consulting and solutions development services designed to help you deploy the right resources at the right time the first time. With decades of experience, our leadership team leverages modern technology and future concepts to deliver our flagship services with excellence. We specialize in helping commercial clients enhance their capabilities while improving operational efficiency, and we champion efforts to help modernize agencies and reduce government burden.We value all employees and job candidates as unique individuals, and we welcome the variety of experiences they bring to our company. As such, we have a strict non-discrimination policy. We believe everyone should be treated equally regardless of race, sex, gender identification, sexual orientation, national origin, native language, religion, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other characteristic protected by law.Wisemen Multimedia LLC (“Wisemen”) is seeking qualified candidates to fill several full-time, part-time, and intern positions. Wisemen embraces diversity and strongly encourages all qualified individuals, including people of varied ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, and physical abilities, to apply, especially if you live in a Historically Underutilized Business Zone (HUBZone). Please copy and paste the link below and enter your home address to determine if you live in a HUBZone. https://maps.certify.sba.gov/hubzone/map#center=39.828200,-98.579500&zoom=5

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Bloomerang combines the best tools, resources, and people to provide a world-class experience for tens of thousands of nonprofits, allowing them to raise more money and do more good in the world. Our powerful software and stellar customer service have made us one of the highest rated fundraising/donor CRMs on the market.



In addition to creating thriving nonprofits, we're also in the business of creating thriving employees*.* At Bloomerang, you'll be a part of a mission-driven culture built on the core values of Empathy, Unity, and Transparency. We know the key to our success is our people, and we're proud to be home to some of the most innovative and skilled employees in the workforce today.

  



The Role



As a Systems Administrator, you will be a part of the Information Technology team working to administer and make architectural decisions with Bloomerang's core technology apps (Okta, Google Workspace, Slack, 1Password, KnowBe4, NinjaOne, Mosyle, etc). You'll utilize excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to convey technical information clearly and concisely. As a Systems Administrator, you'll possess a strong sense of attention to detail in managing system configurations, documentation, and change management processes. This position requires a commitment to maintaining accurate and up-to-date documentation for systems, processes, and procedures.

  



What You Will Do


* Install, configure, test, troubleshoot, perform ongoing maintenance and enhancement of information technology and information systems.
* Facilitate the delivery of projects and solutions in a collaborative team environment across business units.
* Be an escalation point for our Desktop Support Engineers.
* Make applications talk to each other via APIs & Workflow tools

  



What You Need to Succeed


* Experience with Cloud Infrastructure
+ Given the nature of SaaS companies relying heavily on cloud-based technologies, experience with cloud infrastructure is essential. This includes expertise in managing and optimizing cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud (GCP). Experience preferably with AWS.

* Automation and Scripting Skills
+ Automation plays a significant role in streamlining operations, improving efficiency, and reducing human error in IT administration. Therefore, strong scripting skills, particularly in languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell, are crucial.

* Problem-Solving and Troubleshooting Abilities
+ Systems administrators often encounter complex technical issues that require critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and the ability to troubleshoot effectively under pressure. A strong track record of diagnosing and resolving issues is essential.

  




Nice to Haves But Not Required


* Technical Certifications
* SaaS experience
* Advanced Networking skills

  



Benefits



Health + Wellness  

You'll have access to generous health, vision, and dental insurance options, as well as a free subscription to Bright, a wellness platform that offers live and on-demand fitness, meditation, mindfulness, and nutrition classes.

  

Time Off



You'll get a competitive PTO package that includes 20 PTO days, 3 flex days, 4 optional volunteer Days, 12 paid holidays, as well as paid parental leave.

  

401k



You'll receive a 401k match to help invest in your future.

  



Equipment  

Everything you need to be successful, shipped right to your door.

  



Compensation



The salary range for this position is: $81,000 - $109,500. You may also be eligible for a discretionary bonus. Actual compensation within the range will be dependent on your skills, experience, qualifications, and location, as well as applicable employment laws.

  



Location



This is a permanent, full-time, fully remote position. Employees living in Indianapolis, IN are welcome to work from our company headquarters. We do not offer Visa sponsorship or relocation assistance at this time.

  



Accommodations



Applicants who require accommodations may contact careers@bloomerang.com to request an accommodation in completing an application.

  



Bloomerang is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Bloomerang are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

title: DDI Systems Administrator
description:

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Mob Entertainment** is a startup multimedia studio that is best known for our hit indie horror game "**Poppy Playtime"**. Poppy Playtime is one of hottest new properties in gaming, and our team is naturally expanding as our ambition expands. To give a taste of our brand's popularity, Poppy Playtime had 7.5 billion views of Huggy Wuggy videos on YouTube.


WHAT WE DO


* The Mob Entertainment Systems Administrator provides tier 1 & 2 technical support to the game development and business. These teams are spread out over several physical locations in the St. Louis area..
* We act as a key point of contact for technical knowledge and expertise across the company.


RESPONSIBILITIES


* Manage competing priorities effectively ensuring that all relevant parties are informed of project status/changes.
* Develop and ensure compliance to processes and procedures whilst refining where things can be improved upon.
* Communicate effectively with management and provide regular updates.
* Provide out-of-hours support as the need arises.
* Build, configure, and deploy equipment for new and existing employees.
* Upgrade hardware and peripherals as required by the development teams.
* Assist with the development and refinement of the company and remote work future.
* Establish and maintain system directory and cyber security compliance posture.
* Manage users, computers, and groups within the company.
* Maintain asset inventory, including regular physical stock checks.
* Document and maintain accurate installation and procedure guides.
* Moving IT equipment to help with studio and team reorganization.
* Procurement of hardware, software, peripherals, etc.
* IT storeroom housekeeping, hardware recycling and maintaining secure disposal processes.


QUALIFICATIONS


* 4+ years of professional System Administrator or equivalent experience.
* Expertise of current Microsoft operating systems.
* Strong understanding of Active Directory or other system management softwares..
* Strong knowledge of SCCM.
* Basic PowerShell scripting.
* Basic knowledge of Linux and Apple OSX.
* Ability to install, upgrade and maintain PC workstation hardware.


SKILLS


* High-level problem-solving skills.
* Experience with ServiceNow or some other ticketing system.
* Experience with JIRA, Confluence and Perforce software
* Experience with Slack
* Good understanding of gaming hardware.
* Ability to work well within a team and use your own initiative.
* Ability to learn quickly and demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills.
* Ability to follow instructions and processes.
* Self-motivated and organized.
* Customer service focus.
* Ability to manage, interact with, and support ECM servers and data-base instances, particularly on AWS
* Experience with AWS ecosystem ands services


PLUSES



Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.


* Experience supporting performance capture.
* Strong Linux skills.
* Strong scripting skills.

  



OUR CORE VALUES:
* Storytelling
* Quality
* Obsession
* Creativity
* Subversion
* Collaboration
* Scrappiness

  



EMPLOYEE EXPECTATIONS:
* Kindness
* Result-Oriented
* Autonomy
* Efficiency
* Humility
* Be real.
* Be weird.


#LI-Remote


Mob Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or religious creed, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, marital status, family or parental status, disability, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. All employment decisions are based on a person's merit, business needs, and role requirements. If you require further accommodations or have questions regarding accessibility of our roles, please reach out to info@mobentertainment.com

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
**Transflo is committed to building a culture where all employees can bring their best to work, where all employees feel valued, respected, and have a sense of belonging; Transflo embraces diversity and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.**
#### **The Opportunity**


At Transflo, our mission is to be the trusted industry leader delivering innovative customer-focused technology that connects and drives efficiency in the supply chain. Our passionate and engaged team delivers extraordinary customer value and experiences with technology solutions that make a difference for our customers.
**Responsibilities*** Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce environment especially for the Production.
* Primary point of contact for the Salesforce Customer Success team. Establish, monitor and drive action planning and execution for production org performance and health metrics
* Explore and test new platform specific features as part of Salesforce product release upgrades
* Manage installation of the AppExchange apps in Production and on full SandBoxes
* Manage storage, system clean up and data archiving

* Assist in analysis of Salesforce license usage and cost optimization
* Assist DevOps in establishing business continuity planning and help in implementing system backup and recovery processes
* Assist DevOps in release deployment process and sandbox management
* Assist in troubleshooting issues related to Salesforce platform in the areas of security, performance, access and user administration especially the ones with elevated access
* Coordinate with the Admins and Developers and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization.


**Qualifications:**
* 2-4 years of experience in the administration and maintenance of Salesforce.
* Experience in performing Salesforce upgrades and ensuring successful integration.
* Familiarity with the creation and configuration of Salesforce and/or Tableau dashboards and reporting.

* Advanced excel skills and excellent written and verbal communication.
