General office work- computer interactions for long periods of time, stress related to meeting deadlines.Salesforce Administrator

title: Yardi System Administrator
description:
**About Us**

D2D Consulting is the go-to resource for project management and software implementation services. Providing customized development, quality assurance testing, data validation, comprehensive training and help desk support, D2D Consulting offers full end-to-end management and delivery of our client’s processes. D2D Consulting distinguishes themselves with a unique combination of deep business operations knowledge and technology expertise. As a result, we have become a trusted business partner who shares our clients’ vision, achieving a 100% client retention rate and 100% on-time and on-budget project implementation.

**Job Description**

The Yardi System Administrator is responsible for the administration and support of the software, including environment security, software upgrades, implementation of enhancements, management of open issues list, and configuration requests with the goal of ensuring business teams are able to use the system efficiently and accurately. The System Administrator will work closely with clients to understand their business requirements and configure Yardi to meet their needs.

**Responsibilities**

* Maintain and manage client’s Yardi systems to support Property Management, Accounting, and Asset Management functions. This includes acting as the Administrator/Super User for the software, enabling/disabling users, managing role-permissions, setting up new properties, scheduling reports, etc.
* Establish best practices and efficient workflows.
* Responsible for system administration, including maintenance of user security groups, new user set-up and security management, and general user security.
* Manage system upgrades, including testing of existing business processes to ensure efficient rollouts.
* Support data population as needed.
* Maintain property lists and account trees to support reporting, including removal of unused records as needed.
* Delete transactions as needed with appropriate approval.
* Monitor new entity/record setup for completeness and consistency.
* Work directly with business teams to capture customization requests, consulting with business users on Yardi functionality, capturing technical requirements as well as business use cases and building project plans for implementation, including prioritization.
* Oversee and complete system customization or configuration, including monitoring of third-party consultant work.
* Manage user support, including system training, troubleshooting, answering usage questions, and supporting the documentation of system processes.
* Support the extraction of data, including queries as needed to provide answers related to data.
* Responsible for Yardi vendor management, including submitting and tracking open cases with Yardi to ensure efficient resolution, tracking and advocating for software enhancements as needed, and attending vendor conferences.
* Design and implement processes and/or technology solutions to keep Yardi database in sync with other systems that depend on Yardi data.
* Communicate and/or meet with project manager, team members and others on a weekly, monthly, or quarterly basis to give updates and request support when needed. When problems need to be resolved, meet more frequently as needed to return systems to their properly functioning order.
* Stay current on Yardi product updates and new features.
* Contributes to D2D growth by sourcing work through net new and/or existing clients.
* Develop long-term relationships both internally and externally, through interacting and communicating effectively with teammates, clients, and executives.
* Travel based on client need, resource availability, and within CDC recommended safety guidelines.

**Qualifications and Education Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, finance or a related discipline or commensurate work experience required.
* 5+ years of experience implementing and administrative support of Yardi modules required.
* Familiarity with the full suite of Yardi products to include Voyager, Rent Café, Yieldstar, Nexus/Payscan, Forecasting; as well as with associated third-party integrations.
* Experience with Commercial, Elevate and IQ products.
* 2-3 years of experience working at an advanced level with core Microsoft office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) required, and experience with extended Microsoft Suite (Lists, Visio, SharePoint, Forms, PowerBI, Teams, etc.) strongly preferred.
* SQL query knowledge, experience with import/export tools and custom report design required.
* Experience in/exposure to real estate, tax, accounting, fundraising, investor relations and/or finance sectors valued.
* Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels internally and with external vendors.
* Ability to think independently and analytically and make recommendations accordingly
* Collaborative perspective across various audiences to include on-site, corporate departments, clients, and vendors
* Outstanding written and oral communication skills and must possess a strong commitment to customer service
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team

**Preferred Skills**

* Yardi certification
* Experience working with clients in the real estate sector
* Knowledge of other real estate management systems
* Understanding of implementation methodology

**D2D Consultant Expectations**

* Consultants are expected to be prepared for the workday and report or events/meetings on time. In instances when consultants cannot avoid being late or are unable to work as scheduled, they are to notify their supervisor as soon as possible. Consultants must also communicate to the client(s) of any delays. Frequent or unscheduled absences and repeated lateness may result in disciplinary action.
* Consultants are expected to resent a clean, neat, and tasteful appearance appropriate to their position whenever representing D2D.
* Consultants are required to submit work time into the tine management system by the end of every Friday in order to receive payment.
* Theft, unauthorized removal, negligence, destruction, or misuse of D2D property, property of D2D colleagues, or D2D clients is prohibited.
* Consultants who are members of outside professional organizations are to ensure that their involvement in those organizations does not negatively affect their ability to perform their job duties.
* Consultants will communicate regularly to direct management and report status of all projects on a minimum of a weekly basis.
* Consultants will not discriminate, harass, or unfairly treat colleagues or clients because of their race, skin color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation) religion, disability, age, or genetic information.

**Consultant Benefits** 

* Qualifying Sale Commission Opportunities
* Offices is closed on all major holidays

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Yardi: 5 years (Required)
* Database administration: 5 years (Required)
* SQL: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Yardi Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Systems Administrator
description:
**Title: IT Systems Administrator**

**Location: Washington, DC** **Terms: Full-Time/Permanent (Remote with onsite as needed in DC or Ashburn, VA)**

**Clearance: All qualified applicants must be able to pass a federal background check. Must be a US Citizen to be able to obtain the appropriate clearance.**

**Travel: 0-10 %**

*RESULTS. INNOVATION. VALUES. ACCOUNTABILITY.* 

That’s RIVA. Our employee-first approach has manifested a culture that attracts the best and brightest. By investing in people firsts, and providing a flexible work environment, our employees have higher moral, higher productivity rates, and lower turnover. At RIVA, people are our #1 priority.

RIVA Solutions Inc is seeking an IT Systems Administrator with experience in CyberArk tools, supporting the Information Technology Service Desk and Engineering Support program for a Contract at U. S. Department of Health and Human Services.

RIVA is supporting a team that is providing maintenance and operational IT support that includes engineering services for the systems, equipment, hardware, and software. This engineer will design and develop solutions to complex application problems, system administration issues or CyberArk concerns, and performance systems management and integration functions. Part of our support team works onsite in Washington, DC at a government facility and candidates do need to be within local commuting distance (within 50 mile radius) to DC. Primarily, our engineers split time between telework with occasional need to work onsite in DC, or to the data center in Ashburn, VA. Remote work may also be considered for this position.

**Roles and Responsibilities:** The IT Systems Administrators manage, implement, and maintain the Privilege Access Management (PAM) and Identity Management solutions using CyberArk to meet business requirements. Develop relationships across the business to understand requirements, apply technical knowledge to solve business problems and work closely with other teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

**Education/Certification Required:** 7+ years’ experience in a similar role. Bachelor’s degree required. U.S. Citizenship must be able to achieve a Secret clearance/position of trust.

**Required Qualifications:** To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:

* Work on projects as an identity and privilege access management engineer, including identifying the right mix of tools and techniques to translate a client's needs and future goals into a plan that will enable secure and effective solutions.
* Apply expertise to perform discovery and analysis, architecture design, solution design, plan solution implementations, and apply best practices to mature CyberArk capabilities.
* Perform installation and configuration of required CyberArk platform components including supporting enterprise on-boarding, credential discovery, and analysis.
* Support upgrades of CyberArk, including maintenance, patch identification and publication, related modules, develop SOPs and documentation.
* Maintain responsibility for product security and audit findings, privilege user incident management support, user acceptance testing of privilege accounts, and validation testing of PRIV and integrated solutions.
* Identify requirements, design, document, and implement technical solutions for scalable and resilient network architecture.
* Ability to obtain a Public Trust Clearance

**Desired Qualifications:** Other desired qualifications include:

* Experience with designing CyberArk architecture and configuration to meet SOW scope and IAM requirements
* Ability to develop CyberArk configuration and customizations to meet SOW scope and IAM design
* Ability to consult, support, and mentor client stakeholders for all upgrades, deployments, and production operations
* Ability to author and maintain CyberArk IAM Architecture and Design, Configuration, Deployment, and Run Book documents and respective iterations
* Practical experience with PKI solutions, including SSL
* Practical, "field" experience with installing, configuring, and testing PAM solutions.
* Experience integrating PAM solutions with multi-factor authenticators, namely PIV cards
* Experience deploying PAM solutions in backup, high-availability and DR environments (cold, warm and hot)
* Experience with Windows operating systems, Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) and Active Directory (AD), Windows PowerShell, Windows credential stores, Microsoft Certificate Authority
* Proven ability to work closely with customer's network and operations team to resolve issues or security concerns of tools/services.
* Proven ability to work with vendors in troubleshooting and resolving issues related to identified security tools
* Extensive experience working with clients to provide design & architectural guidance and best practice recommendations for safe design, access control policies, and other related security requirements or needs
* Bachelor's degree and 7+ years of related technical experience with a minimum of 4 years’ experience implementing and administering CyberArk in an enterprise environment.
* Relevant IAM/PRIV/PAM tool certifications, e.g. CyberArk level 3 (Sentry) or higher
* Self-starter and strategic thinker.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills and executive presence that enable effective engagement with senior stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently and communicate the technical and security related issues to client/business stakeholders effectively and professionally.
* Ability to provide technical leadership to Junior Engineers on tasks and projects, and communicate abstract concepts to gain support from stakeholders.

**Nice to have Qualifications:**

* Programming languages and APIs: Java, BeanShell, Python, REST, JSON, SOAP
* Experience with integrating PAM solutions like Splunk and/or IAM tools like SailPoint.
* Experience with other PRIV solutions (CA-PAM, Centrify, Oracle Identity Management, Microsoft Identity Management)

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!  

In this role, you will be a key member of our growing Salesforce team (comprised of engineers and admins).This role is for a proactive individual that can help us continually improve and enhance our Salesforce platform, gathering requirements and feedback from various business units, designing scalable best practice solutions, and managing the product road map. Our Salesforce user experience is a top concern, and as such our Salesforce Administrators facilitate all aspects of user management including support tickets, training, and designing solutions with user satisfaction as a priority.  

This role requires a good understanding of the Salesforce platform, and a desire to continue to learn new things in Salesforce. Our Salesforce Administrators must understand both our current setup and our business objectives, to quickly identify areas of improvement. The Salesforce Administrator should be comfortable with change management and governance, communicating, prioritizing, and managing all aspects of a Salesforce project. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a team environment, with stakeholders at all levels and can translate technical information into layman’s terms, clearly explaining design options and their potential impact.
### **How you'll add value:**

+ User and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, sharing rules etc.
+ Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards and reports.
+ Sandbox environment management.
+ Identify and gather requirements, translating into best practice, scalable solutions with a focus on user experience.
+ Identify unused or underutilized platform features.
+ Collaborate on R365’s Salesforce platform roadmap by working with the Salesforce team and stakeholders to define priorities.
+ Own the communication of any platform changes to end users and stakeholders.
+ Data management to improve R365’s Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed.
+ Proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer.
+ User support tickets through Salesforce Cases and Slack/Jira.
+ Monitor and improve user adoption.
+ New user and ongoing user training.
+ Technical documentation.
+ Working with integrated applications including Intacct, Clari, Salesloft, LeanData, ZoomInfo, Spiff, Marketo, Bizible, Gainsight, Pendo, Freshdesk etc.
+ Other duties as assigned.

### **What you'll need to be successful in this role:**

+ Valid Salesforce Certifications in the following: Administrator, Business Analyst.
+ 2+ years of Administrator experience on Salesforce & Force platforms.
+ Strong interpersonal skills, and ability to work with teams and stakeholders of different backgrounds and time zones in a multicultural environment.
+ Designing scalable, best practice solutions.
+ Excellent relationship-building skills.
+ Translating requirements into technical solutions.
+ Experience in change management and governance.
+ Training end users and key stakeholders.
+ Proven ability in producing technical documentation.
+ Available and responsive to questions.
+ Experience implementing Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards, and reports.
+ Experience working with Agile teams and use of tools such as Jira, monday.com, etc.
+ Experience working in a SaaS environment preferred.
+ Experience working with Apex Code and custom Apex Classes preferred.
+ Experience with managed packages and AppExchange preferred.
+ Experience with CPQ preferred.
+ Pacific Time Zone working hours preferred.

### **R365 Team Member Benefits & Compensation**

+ This position has a salary range of $100K-$110K per year. The above range represents the expected salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
+ Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
+ 401k + matching
+ Equity Option Grant
+ Unlimited PTO + Company holidays
+ Wellness initiatives
  

#BI-Remote
$100,000 - $110,000 a year
R365 is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all forward-thinkers who embrace change and possess a positive attitude to apply.

title: Sr. Network System Administrator
description:
**PURPOSE AND SCOPE:**
The Senior Network Systems Administrator is responsible for the design, planning, operation, security, and day to day management of the organization's org-wide network, servers, switches, network connected devices.
**PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:**
* Establish and configure networks for organization-wide use
* Determines the organization’s data management and information technology needs and decides how to set up the network and provide users and the organization as a whole with constant access to servers and data storage sites
* Determines areas of the IT infrastructure that need particular attention or expertise, directs system network administrators to resolve user-side issues, and manages the overall workflow of the IT department
* Maintains reliable system performance through active monitoring of error logs and user-reported server and/or network issues
* Conducts regular tests to ensure that the system meets expectations for speed, security, and reliability
* Work with technicians and administrators to conduct routine system audits, making recommendations to improve reliability and performance
* Lead teams to develop and deploy performance-enhancing measures throughout the network
* Works with team members to design and oversee server-side elements of an organization’s network infrastructure. This can include installing network-wide malware protection software, developing firewalls, and configuring databases and access on the back end
* Makes decisions regarding network/systems upgrades and repairs


**EDUCATION:**
* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent experience required.

**EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS**
* 5 – 7 years of experience installing, configuring, and managing infrastructure, hardware and software systems
* Highly experienced at configuring software and hardware including servers, networks, and operating systems
* Possess advanced skills in designing workflow and network diagrams along with technical manuals with a firm grasp of best practices and procedures to ensure that organization data is protected from intrusion or corruption
* Working knowledge of systems architecture, analysis, design, security methodologies, software installations, and trouble-shooting techniques
* Extensive experience configuring and managing software and hardware related to LANs and WANs
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
* Must be a team player, be organized and have the ability to handle multiple projects
* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision or function in a team environment sharing responsibility, roles, and accountability
* Ability to lead without authority and motivate teams to achieve tactical and strategic goals. This is a highly responsible position that requires both quantitative and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated project management, organization and facilitation skills.
* High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and exude the appropriate level of judgment and maturity.


**Preferred Licensing/Certifications:**
* Certifications desired: CCNA, CCNP, Network+ Certification or A+


**CUSTOMER SERVICE:**
* Responsible for driving the HXG culture through values and customer service standards.
* Accountable for outstanding customer service to all external and internal contacts.
* Develops and maintains positive relationships through effective and timely communication.
* Takes initiative and action to respond, resolve and follow up regarding customer service issues with all customers in a timely manner

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Systems Administrator**  

  

**Who is Fusion Technology?**  

  

Fusion Technology is a performance-driven HUBZone Small Business concern residing in the heart of the beautiful mountainsides of West Virginia, steps away from the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Criminal Justice Information Services Division's Headquarters. Founded in 2007 by an Engineer-by-trade, Fusion Technology dedicates our valuable resources to providing comprehensive IT services and solutions to mission-critical US Government programs and the Intel Community.  

  

**Who are you?**  

* *Security-cleared Professional:* You have made it through the process of receiving a United States government security clearance – congratulations! We know you are a trustworthy intel professional because you have an active **Secret** security clearance.
* ***Experience is important to us:*** You have a Bachelor’s degree with:
	+ ***Junior level –*** 3+ years
	+ ***Mid-level –*** 7+ years
	+ ***Senior level –*** 10+ years

  

  

Position location: Remote (occasional travel to the main work site for special events)  

  

**What you’ll do:*** Responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems. System administrator will ensure the uptime, performance, resources, and security of the computers they manage meet the needs of the users. The systems administrator could be focused in one or more of the following areas:
* A database administrator (DBA) maintains a database system, and is responsible for the integrity of the data and the efficiency and performance of the system.
* A network administrator maintains network infrastructure such as switches and routers, and diagnoses problems with these or with the behavior of network-attached computers.
* A security administrator is a specialist in computer and network security, including the administration of security devices such as firewalls, as well as consulting on general security measures.
* A web administrator maintains web server services that allow for internal or external access to web sites. Tasks include managing multiple sites, administering security, and configuring necessary components and software. Responsibilities may also include software change management.
* A system programmer creates, modifies, and test the code, forms, and script that allow computer applications to run. They may also develop and write computer programs to store, locate, and retrieve specific documents, data, and information.
* A computer operator performs routine maintenance and upkeep, such as changing backup tapes or replacing failed drives.

  

  

**What matters to you matters to us.**  

  

Fusion Technology values its employees and works hard to ensure proper care for them and their families. We desire to compensate employees in a competitive, motivational, fair, and equitable way with other employers in the marketplace. Salary is only one component of employee compensation but an integral part of recruiting and retaining qualified employees. However, at Fusion Technology, we take a comprehensive approach and consider each employee's needs to tailor a compensation plan that provides financial security and peace of mind. Our competitive package includes a best-in-class matching 401K program, comprehensive Meritain healthcare plan, a competitive employer contribution to a health savings account, vision and dental plans, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and personal leave, in addition to paid certifications and training.  

  

Fusion Technology LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Financial Systems Administrator
description:
**Description**



Sprout Social is looking to hire a Financial Systems Administrator to the Corporate IT Team who will ensure our tools and integrations between them are configured, managed, and running efficiently. You will be a dedicated partner for our Finance team with a focus on scalability and collaboration with the larger corporate IT team.


**Why join Sprout's IT team?**



Sprout's Corporate IT team is a combination of adjacent squads working on projects under one umbrella. This unique structure is an exciting opportunity to grow your career in technology with exposure to projects across multiple disciplines—something you don't often see in other organizations. It allows us to move quickly and collaborate with minimal friction or red tape. As a part of this team, you're also given the space and expected to stretch beyond your core function, and make a deeper impact on the broader organization. In short, the work you do here matters, and you feel that day in and day out.


**What you'll do**



As the Financial Systems Administrator at Sprout, you will develop a deep understanding of Sprout's overall mission and how our multiple Finance, Accounting, Billing, and Integrations, "back office", tooling fits in. You will conduct thorough process reviews and guide the Finance department in gaining overall efficiency within their day to day tasks. We will need an individual who has a general understanding of the compliance and regulatory needs of a publicly-traded business, and has a solid technical foundation. If you're a self-starter who enjoys tackling complex problems while working on a small, fast-paced team, we'd love to talk to you! .


**What you'll bring**



We are looking for an organized and motivated Financial Systems Admin with experience overseeing Financial tooling and an expert on the NetSuite platform. There is an expectation that all tools and processes are scalable, pristine, and well-documented for your teammates, and you'll use your experience to lift those around you. You will have a strong understanding of basic accounting principles and concepts, along with a deep understanding of core record structure within an ERP system. This role will require someone who is confident and has the ability to make decisions and execute. There will be a focus on building the right functionality in the right order and helping overcome obstacles. You must be highly analytical, diligent, and naturally curious with the ability to improvise and develop creative and collaborative solutions when common approaches fail.



These are the minimum qualifications that our hiring team is looking for in this role:


* 3+ years of experience as a NetSuite system administrator in a publicly traded company while adhering to a strict SOX change management process.
* A subject matter expert with business acumen, an understanding of core finance processes, quote to cash, record to report, and procure to pay.
* Experience configuring and enhancing NetSuite Modules, such as Fixed Asset Module, NetSuite Electronic Payment Module, Cash Matching Module.


Additionally, these are the preferred qualifications that would indicate a particularly strong candidate:


* Experience managing projects independently
* A clear understanding of the security, scalability, maintainability, and training required for our financial software
* Hands-on experience with our existing software specifically, Salesforce, Salesforce Billing, and payment providers (such as Recurly or Stripe)
* An understanding of how credit card gateways are integrated into financial systems.


**Within 1 month, you will:**


* Have completed Sprout Social's two-week new hire training and onboarding program alongside other new Sprout team members. In these sessions, you will gain a broad understanding of our products and how your role directly impacts the product, overall organization, and our customers.
* Documented and created a plan with your manager to set initial priorities, align on expectations for your role, and learn about Sprout's existing toolset.
* Be immersed in the current tooling and begin to build working relationships with stakeholders throughout our Finance, Billing and Corporate IT teams as well as your co-workers.
* You have developed an understanding of the Corporate IT project management and development lifecycles.


**Within 3 months, you will:**


* You are the go to person on the team for day to day support of financial systems operational tickets.
* You have evaluated and updated, refined, and improved documentation and processes.
* You have worked with requesters and stakeholders to produce detailed and effective change requests.
* Continue to support internal and external audits by gathering evidence and updating/improving documentation
* Established communication channels with your team to create and prioritize tasks/projects to meet our existing needs/commitments.


**Within 6 months, you will:**


* Built connections with members from other teams through active networking and community building.
* Delivered at least one efficiency gain that reduces the time it takes accounting to close the books each month end
* Have a review process for incoming requests and have guided solutions to align with our overall architectural and business goals.
* You are an expert on our internal processes and begin delivering larger change and feature requests to make our teams more efficient.
* Delivered at least 1 larger initiative from scoping through delivery.
* Worked and effectively communicated with other groups across the organization to ensure big-picture alignment and cross-team collaboration.
* Formed a career growth plan with your manager and started work towards it. (may involve certification, conference, or other continuing education)
* Ensured that processes are well documented and preventative maintenance/measures are designed and implemented


**Within 12 months, you will:**


* Have become a go-to expert on our finance tooling and the inbound and outbound integrations
* Delivered solutions to ensure our systems and tooling stays ahead of and empower our companies growth
* Improved and maintained the various processes, adapting to changing requirements and ensuring accurate documentation
* Efficiently deliver day-to-day, with very little support.
* Identify, advocate and effectively contribute to larger change and feature requests.
* Have participated in cross-organizational projects, demonstrating project management skills, consensus building, and strong leadership.
* Surprise us! Use your unique ideas and abilities to change Sprout in beneficial ways that we haven't even considered yet.


Of course, what is outlined above is the ideal timeline, but things may shift based on business needs and other projects and tasks could be added at the discretion of your manager.


**Our Benefits Program**



We're proud to regularly be recognized for our team, product and culture. Our benefits program includes:


* Insurance and benefit options that are built for both individuals and families
* Progressive policies to support work/life balance, like our flexible paid time off and parental leave program
* High-quality and well-maintained equipment—your computer will never prevent you from doing your best
* Wellness initiatives to ensure both health and mental well-being of our team
* Ongoing education and development opportunities via our Grow@Sprout program and employee-led diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives.
* Growing corporate social responsibility program that is driven by the involvement and passion of our team members
* Beautiful, convenient and state-of-the-art offices in Chicago's Loop and downtown Seattle, for those who prefer an office setting


*Whenever possible, Sprout wants to provide our team with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for them. Sprout maintains a remote workforce in many places in the United States. However, we are not set up in all states, so please look at the drop-down box in our application to see whether your state is listed. Few roles require an office setting. If your position requires a physical presence in a Sprout office, it will be evident in the job listing and your offer letter.*



The base pay range for this role is $90,000 to $120,000 USD annually. Individual base pay is based on various factors, including relevant experience and skills, the responsibility of the role, and job duties/requirements. In addition to base pay, some Sales and Success roles can earn sales incentives.



Sprout's compensation ranges are intentionally broad to allow for our team members' growth within their role. These ranges were determined by a market-based compensation approach; we used data from trusted third-party compensation sources to set equitable, consistent and competitive ranges. We also evaluate compensation bi-annually, identify any changes in the market and make adjustments to our ranges and existing employee compensation as needed.


*Base pay is only one element of an employee's total compensation at Sprout. Every Sprout team member has an opportunity to receive restricted stock units (RSUs) under Sprout's equity plan. Employees (and their dependents) are covered by medical, dental, vision, basic life, accidental death, and dismemberment insurance, and Modern Health (a wellness benefit). Employees are able to enroll in Sprout's company's 401k plan, in which Sprout will match 50% of your contributions up to 6% with a maximum contribution. Sprout offers "Flexible Paid Time Off" and ten paid holidays. We have outlined the various components to an employee's full compensation package* *here* *to help you to understand our total rewards package.*



Sprout Social is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and an Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate based on identity**-** race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex (including sexual identity), age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran or military status, unfavorable discharge from military service, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, citizenship status, arrest record or expunged or sealed convictions, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in our latest DEI Report.



If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at accommodations@sproutsocial.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. We'll do all we can to ensure you're set up for success during our interview process while upholding your privacy, including requests for accommodation. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.



For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity, please click here (1) Equal Opportunity Employment Poster (2) Sprout Social's Affirmative Action Statement (3) Pay Transparency Statement.



When you apply for employment with Sprout Social, we will process your job applicant data, including your employment and education history, transcript, writing samples, and references as necessary to consider your job application for open positions. Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., and Crosschq, Inc., cloud services providers located in the United States of America and engaged by Sprout Social to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller's behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, by clicking "Submit Application" on this site, you consent to the transfer of your personal data to the United States. For more information about our privacy practices please visit our Privacy Policy. California residents have additional rights and should review the Additional Disclosures for California Residents section in our Privacy Policy.



Additionally, Sprout Social participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

title: Server Administrator
description:
Connexus Credit Union - Who We Are:
Serving members across all 50 states, Connexus Credit Union is a member-focused cooperative that is proud to return profits to member-owners through high yields for checking accounts and deposit products, as well as competitive rates for personal, home, and auto loans. From its early beginnings on through the years, Connexus has remained a strong, growing, and secure financial institution that remains committed to serving the financial needs of our member-owners across the country.
Connexus offers an Amazing Benefits package:* 25 days of paid time off and 7 paid holidays
* 16 hours of paid Volunteer Time Off
* 401K Retirement with up to 6% employer match
* Excellent Health, Dental, Vision insurance, including multiple plan options
* Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions
* Employer paid Life insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement from $4,000 - $7,000 per calendar year
* Robust Learning and Development program that includes an annual professional development stipend

  

Connexus has a Values-Based Culture:
Our Values of Integrity, Respect, Transparency, Wellbeing and Synergy aren't just words on a page; our values dictate the actions of the organization and everyone within it. We demonstrate our values in every personal interaction, phone call, and email ‐ every day.
About the Role:
The Server Administrator is an individual contributor role and will report to the IT Operations Manager. We are looking for a Server Administrator to assist with installations, configuration, and maintenance on a variety of hardware and software items which often involve creating users accounts, carrying out backup and recovery functions and monitoring performance of servers.
The typical workweek may include working with business leaders and end users. Deploying servers in a physical and virtual environment, patching Windows, and Linux servers, and assisting with Security remediation efforts. To ensure success as a Server Administrator, you should exhibit sound knowledge of server infrastructure (Linux and Windows), M365 technology stack, Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, and other related technologies. Success will be measured in terms of your ability to deliver results that meet or exceed the agreed upon requirements.
Responsibilities:*Server and Ticket Administration: 60% of typical work volume** Under general supervision, assume the responsibility for maintaining the server environment (Windows and Linux).
* Participates in the patch management effort for the server environment (Windows and Linux) utilizing Ivanti ISEC and WSUS.
* Responsible for updating, managing and distribution of tickets utilizing the designated ITSM tool.
* Provisioning of CPU, memory, and storage resources.
* Lifecycle management of server environments.
* Participates in the integration of Active Directory and Azure AD with other systems.
* Participate in continuous improvement of all IT processes used by the Server team.
* Analyzing system logs and identifying potential issues with core systems.
* Escalation and coordination of issues with vendors as needed.
* Implement and maintain systems automation solutions.
* Oversee application deployments and upgrades.
* Interpret and solve problems either user initiated or via system alerts.
* Perform root-cause analysis of IT issues as needed in a complex, fast-paced environment.

*Platform Maintenance 20% of typical work volume** Responsible for monitoring the environment for changes to ensure systems are running efficiently.
* Support the organization by monitoring Monitor storage capacity of the environment to ensure appropriate space is available while addressing retention policies for the business.
* Installing with general supervision, operating systems, service packs, as well as security patches, bug fixes and protecting against security threats.

*Records & Document Management: 10% of typical work volume** Participates in updating server-related standard operating procedures.
* Create\\Update changes controls utilizing the designated Service Desk tool.
* Creates release documents (i.e., change control records) for significant change or new site releases.
* Ensures the confidentiality and security of records is maintained.

*IT Administration and Other Duties: 10% of typical work volume** Keeping informed of developments in server, security and cloud related technologies and products.
* Participating in investigation of emerging and evolving technologies and architecture.


Position Requirements:* This position is Remote.
* Associates degree in Networking, Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent work experience in IT Operations is Required.
* 2+ years of Server administration experience is Required.
* 1+ years’ experience with Azure Active Directory is Required.
* Proficient with Nutanix with AHV.
* Participate in planning, organizing, evaluating, and redesigning systems to meet company needs.
* Proficient in Linux and Windows environments.
* Experience in network, server, and application-status monitoring.
* Proficient in scripting/programming with emphasis in PowerShell.


Connexus Credit Union's Recent Recognitions:* 2022 Best Credit Union – Bankrate
* 2022 Best Checking Account – Forbes Advisor
* 2022 Best Credit Union in the U.S – Kiplinger
* Fourth Largest Credit Union in Wisconsin (by asset size)

*Equal Opportunity* *Employer/Disabled/Veterans/41* *CFR 60–1.4, 41 CFR 60-1.35*

title: Information Technology Administrator (Remote)
description:
**About Dew Wealth Management**

Dew Wealth Management is a Fiduciary Investment Advisory Firm that provides “Virtual Family Office” wealth management services to entrepreneurs through a model that is disrupting the investment advisory industry. Our visionary model and elite team of highly entrepreneurial advisors has resulted in an aggressive growth trajectory that Inc. Magazine has recognized as one of the fastest-growing privately held companies in the United States. We have also been lauded by Investment News as one of the “Best Places to Work for Financial Advisors,” and are a “Great Place to Work” certified company.

If you love being challenged by complex problems and are hungry for an opportunity to rapidly advance your skillset and career, Dew Wealth Management offers a collaborative and supportive culture that will invest in your professional development in equal measure to your investments in our clients’ success.

**About the Position**

If you’re looking for an opportunity to build out the nascent IT Department of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization, taking senior responsibility, not just for systems administration, but also for driving new initiatives designed to scale our IT infrastructure as this company grows from 34 employees to 100+ over the next few years, our IT Administrator (aka System Administrator) role may be for you.

Reporting directly to our , you will be the first full-time IT hire into this company, responsible for helping us reduce our independence on our outsourced IT vendor while also up-leveling (a) the technical support we can give our growing team of remote employees, and (b) the sophistication and scalability of our IT infrastructure. It’s an opportunity to play a pivotal role in building out the IT infrastructure of a rapidly growing company as it scales.

This is not an entry-level role. We’re looking for someone with significant experience in Office 365 network administration to come alongside us to up-level our IT architecture in a way that will help this company scale efficiently and securely. An ideal applicant would, therefore, have a degree in computer science, systems engineering, or network administration, as well as a Microsoft 365 Certification as a “Teams Administrator Associate” with an “Administrator Expert” certification being preferred. With that said, we understand that many of the most talented IT professionals took career paths that didn’t go through traditional educational institutions, nor have they prioritized chasing Microsoft certification to validate skills they have acquired through experience. So, if it’s possible for you to quickly get the aforementioned Microsoft Certifications, that would enhance your application. But we will give all applicants an opportunity to demonstrate their skills and experience throughout this process, even if they don’t check all the rigid academic and certification boxes that would be ideal.

**Working within a Distributed Workforce**

This is a fully remote role. Approximately four times per year, we will pay you to fly out to our headquarters in Scottsdale, AZ to get an opportunity to connect with your colleagues in person and align on quarterly objectives. Beyond that, however, your primary interaction with your colleagues will be through the cloud-based tech stack we leverage to align our distributed workforce, which includes employees across the United States.

Notwithstanding the virtual nature of our model, at present, we are only hiring applicants who reside within the continental United States (excluding CA) to minimize HR and tax complexities and to keep our team within four time zones of each other.

**Key Responsibilities**

Provide administrative and technical support for all IT assets within our diverse tech stack.

* Serve as the primary administrator of all assets within our diverse tech stack.
* Creating user accounts, performing access control, and assist colleagues with issues as they arise.
* Performing diagnostic tests and debugging procedures to optimize computer systems.
* Identify, diagnose, and resolve any technical issues that arise, ensuring minimal downtime and disruption to operations.
* Configure and enforce SSO policies accross our tech stack, as well as all related password policies and security best practices.

Manage and up-level our hybrid server architecture.

* Configure and manage all aspects of Office 365 users, from email and group setup, to teams and SharePoint administraton.
* Plan, test, and implement upgrades to the network infrastructure to improve performance and security.
* Manage the installation of servers, network devices, and firewalls to ensure a secure and efficient network environment.
* Continuously monitor the performance of all servers, software, and hardware to ensure they are operating efficiently and effectively.
* Coordinate the deployment of new applications, ensuring they are integrated smoothly and efficiently into the existing infrastructure.

Drive the creation of enterprise-grade IT systems architecture and management.

* Drive the buildout and implementation of new IT initiatives. (E.G. Transition of our DMS to SharePoint Online.)
* Maintain and update technical documentation related to system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
* Work with Chief Operating Officer to put in place enterprise-grade security architecture and policies to comply with SEC expectations.

**Qualifications**

Required soft skills:

* Enthusiasm, high integrity, and a commitment to live out the organization’s 5 core values of transparency, collaboration, curiosity, visionariness, and hustle.
* Desire to grow intellectually and professionally as part of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization.
* Intellectually curious, with ability to help others navigate a tech stack designed to organize a distributed workforce.

Required Hard/Technical Skills & Abilities:

* Office 365 Administration
* SharePoint Online Administration
* Hybrid Network Administration, including familiarity with Active Directory administration and PowerShell scripting.

Education, Certification & Experience Requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems engineering or network administration.
* Microsoft 365 Certification as a "Teams Administrator Associate" with an "Administrator Expert" certification being preferred.
* 3+ years of IT Administration experience within a professional services or tech firm at a minimum, 5+ years' experience preferred.

… or equivalent experience, and the ability to demonstrate the requisite level of technical skills the degrees and certifications above are designed to validate.

**Compensation**

Compensation for this role is $70,000 per year. Additionally, the firm offers a generous benefits package that includes, among other benefits, flexible PTO, fully subsidized healthcare, a 401(k)-matching program, and an Employee Stock Option Plan.

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
At First Advantage, people are at the heart of everything we do. This mindset spans from our customers and partners, to our greatest strength: our team members. Join us if you want to say “hello” to a rewarding career, and pave the way as an industry leader in mission-critical background screening solutions to some of the most recognized Fortune 100 and Global 500 brands.

**Who We Are**


We are on the frontline of the Great Onboarding, empowering organizations to Hire Smarter. Onboard Faster™. First Advantage (Nasdaq: FA) is an HR Tech company that delivers innovative solutions and insights to enable our clients to manage risk and hire the best talent. Leveraging an advanced global technology platform, First Advantage builds fully scalable, configurable screening programs that meet the unique needs of over 33,000 clients across the world. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA and with a globally distributed workforce spanning 28 locations with 5,500+ employees, First Advantage performs over 93 million screens in over 200 countries and territories annually.

**Who You Are**


We are looking for a team member who considers themselves:

* Self-motivated – you love to lead others but are also ready to “roll up your sleeves." You can spearhead a project and see it through from start to completion.
* A team player – you navigate cross-functional teams and work well with team members across groups toward a common goal. While you are an independent contributor, you appreciate the value in collaboration.
* An innovator – you see gaps in current processes or workflows as an opportunity to improve and try something new.
* A lifelong learner – you seek opportunities to learn and upskill, you understand the importance of thorough and secure screenings, and are interested in the Human Capital sector and the confluence of people, process, and technology.

**What You'll Do**


Our IT Support Specialist will act as a single point of contact while providing the highest level of customer service, the Service Desk works to get answers for all IT and non-IT queries. To resolve many requests, they follow troubleshooting steps or reference Knowledge Base (KB) articles. Otherwise, gathering all the information required and route the request on the users’ behalf to the right support person or team within First Advantage to complete the customer’s request. Additionally, the Technical Support team will help monitor the users support request until completion. More specifically, the team member in this position will:

* Provide end user support in person, via phone or electronically.
* Diagnose and resolve issues using available knowledgebase and other resources.
* Ensure ticket logging and proper documentation for all issues. Conduct daily follow ups on pending tickets to facilitate closure with adherence to SLAs.
* Set up and configure desktops, printers, fingerprint scanners, and other peripherals.
* Handle escalations and ensure they are quickly resolved. Escalate issues to appropriate teams when required.
* Develop relationships with points of contact across the organization. May support basic training efforts for junior engineers and help in development of team.
* administration to include but not limited to account and group creation/management.
* Ensure proper documentation of ticket and ticket logging for all issues reported.
* Coordinate issue resolution with third parties as needed. Monitor uptime of servers. Become familiar with support policies and procedures.
* Develop daily reports to track team performance and update managers. Become familiar with other internal departments, their systems and applications.

**What You May Need to be Successful**

* Associate’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred (technical or analytical field a plus)
* 1+ years specializing in remote desktop support, systems administration, or IT Operations in a Windows environment
* Familiarity with ITIL processes (TIL V3 certification is an added advantage)
* Systems Architecture and integration experience preferred (specifying hardware, network configuration, etc.)
* Microsoft Office 2013 and above
* Outlook 2013 and above
* Knowledge of TCP/IP networking, and related network services (i.e. DNS, SMTP, DHCP, etc)
* Previous work experience in a corporate environment
* Experience supporting Outlook in a Microsoft Exchange environment
* Experience supporting a variety of WiFi-enabled devices
* Experience supporting remote users
* Basic knowledge of thin client systems, network printers, citrix, terminal servers

**Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:**

* Excellent communication skills and experience working in a global setup
* Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical people
* Ability to recognize, analyze, and effectively solve problems in a timely and organized manner using industry best practices and procedures
* Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

**Why First Advantage is Your Next Big Career Move**


First Advantage is going through a technology transformation! We are looking for experts who are excited to work with advanced technologies and provide best-in-class user experiences, drive the development and deployment of scalable solutions, and smoothly guide our agile teams and clients through meaningful changes as we continue to expand our impact.

**Additional benefits offered to our eligible people include:**

* Hybrid work model: most roles are remote with occasional business travel
* Competitive leave and time off policies
* Access to internal career opportunities and Global Talent mobility programs
* Custom soft skills programs on topics like mentoring, managing, and more
* Continuous learning and development opportunities via e-learning platforms
* Training and Certification reimbursement programs
* Medical Insurance options for employees, with parental insurance benefits available, plus ongoing Employee Wellness programs
* Recurring Reward and Recognition programs to celebrate top performers
* Other attractive allowances for weekend working, holiday pay, relocation assistance, Maternity bonus, Creche allowance, and more

**More About Our Values Code**

* Honor Honesty, Consistency, Responsibility: Do the right thing
* Cultivate an environment of dignity: Show respect for the individual
* Take an Outside-In approach: Put the client first
* Think out-of-the-box: Innovate and create
* Stay Team-Oriented: Collaborate and appreciate each other

**What Are You Waiting For? Apply Today!**


You have learned a little about us today – we want to learn about you! If you think this position and our company are a great fit for your areas of interest and expertise, tell us about you by applying now!


United States Equal Opportunity Employment:


First Advantage is proud to be a global leader in removing barriers and supporting our community members to ensure the changing demographics of the workforce are reflected in our hiring and employment practices. We value all of our candidates, employees, and clients, and place great emphasis on hiring and supporting qualified individuals in each role. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other area protected by applicable law.

title: System Administrator (IT)
description:
**System Administrator**
**POSITION SUMMARY**
The System Administrator is responsible for managing Allied Benefit Systems’ private cloud server environment including maintaining systems availability, configuration changes, performance tuning, security vulnerability remediations, and ensuring data protection.
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
* Schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT change control policies and procedures.


* Performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and other software packages.


* Monitors and tunes the server environment to achieve optimum performance levels.


* Installs and monitors security auditing software and remediates defects based on security policies.


* Develops and promotes standard operating procedures.


* Provides technical oversight for new technology projects.


* Develops and maintains a comprehensive operating system, hardware, and software configuration database/library and all supporting documentation.


* Responds to system alerts and engages in troubleshooting and problem resolution.


* Collaborates with IT leadership and vendors on capabilities and improvements needed to meet customer requirements.


**EDUCATION**
* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or similar, or equivalent work experience.


**EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS**
* 5 or more years’ experience as a Windows / VMware systems administrator in public / private cloud environments required.


* 5 or more years’ experience as a Systems Administrator in an environment supporting an organization of 500 – 1000 employees, or similar in size, scope, and complexity is required.


* Expert level experience with Windows Server operating systems required.


* Expert level experience with Microsoft Active Directory required.


* Experience with PowerShell CLI Scripting and Automation required.


* Expert level experience with software distribution and automated patch deployment tools (Tanium, BigFix, SCCM) required.


* Expert Level experience with VMware suite of products required.


* Microsoft SQL Server experience required.


* Knowledge of networking and security technologies preferred.


* Experience with data protection technologies (example Cohesity, Zerto, etc.) preferred.


**POSITION COMPETENCIES**
* Job Knowledge


* Time Management


* Accountability


* Communication


* Initiative


* Customer Focus


**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**
* This is an office environment requiring extended sitting and computer work


**WORK ENVIRONMENT**
* Remote

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
About GoodLeap:
GoodLeap is a technology company delivering best-in-class financing and software products for sustainable solutions, from solar panels and batteries to energy-efficient HVAC, heat pumps, roofing, windows, and more. Over 1 million homeowners have benefited from our simple, fast, and frictionless technology that makes the adoption of these products more affordable, accessible, and easier to understand. Thousands of professionals deploying home efficiency and solar solutions rely on GoodLeap’s proprietary, AI-powered applications and developer tools to drive more transparent customer communication, deeper business intelligence, and streamlined payment and operations. Our platform has led to more than $27 billion in financing for sustainable solutions since 2018.

GoodLeap is also proud to support our award-winning nonprofit, GivePower, which is building and deploying life-saving water and clean electricity systems, changing the lives of more than 1.6 million people across Africa, Asia, and South America.  

Position Summary
The Salesforce Administrator will be a key member of Salesforce team, responsible for configuration, customization, and maintenance of our Salesforce platform. This role requires a deep understanding of Salesforce best practices, business processes, and system integrations. Additionally, the role will collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable Salesforce solutions.  

  

We are looking for someone who can understand our current Salesforce implementation and business objectives to help drive adoption and identify opportunities for organizational efficiency. The ideal candidate will feel comfortable implementing Salesforce solutions that meet the needs and requirements of the organization.
### **Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Perform hands on development and maintain business logic using Lightning Flows, OmniStudio, etc.
* Design, configure, and customize Salesforce to support organizational processes including Case management, Knowledge management, and omni-channel routing.
* Engage in evaluation of scope & technical solutions on new Salesforce feature requests
* Proactively monitor Salesforce system performance and conduct regular maintenance activities, including system upgrades
* Stay current with Salesforce releases and new features, evaluating their potential impact on the organization and recommending adoption as appropriate
* Manage integrations with third-party applications and systems to ensure seamless data flow and integration
* Manage Data Extractions, analysis, and Data Loads into Salesforce

### **Required Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:**

* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards
* Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
* Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce and all upstream and downstream applications, systems, and processes
* Ability to coordinate work with geographically dispersed project team – Zoom/ Slack/ Email connectivity & presence balanced with the ability to get things done is required

### **The ideal candidate will have:**

* Minimum 3+ years of experience as a Salesforce.com administrator
* Experience with Service Cloud, Data Cloud, and Salesforce Shield preferred
* Salesforce.com Admin (ADM201 and ADM211) certified
* Service Cloud or Platform Builder certifications preferred; Developer certification optional and helpful
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* Strong understanding of Salesforce architecture, data model, and security mode
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment preferred

 **Additional Information Regarding Job Duties and Job Descriptions:**  

Job duties include additional responsibilities as assigned by one's supervisor or other managers related to the position/department. This job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and other skills required for the position. The Company reserves the right at any time with or without notice to alter or change job responsibilities, reassign or transfer job position or assign additional job responsibilities, subject to applicable law. The Company shall provide reasonable accommodations of known disabilities to enable a qualified applicant or employee to apply for employment, perform the essential functions of the job, or enjoy the benefits and privileges of employment as required by the law. **If you are an extraordinary professional who thrives in a collaborative work culture and values a rewarding career, then we want to work with you! Apply today!**

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
At Cast & Crew, we've empowered creativity and supported the global entertainment industry for decades. Together with our family of brands - Backstage, CAPS, Checks & Balances, Final Draft, Media Services, Sargent-Disc, and The TEAM Companies – we operate as a combined entertainment technology and services provider offering industry standard screenwriting accounting software, digital payroll products, data & reporting, and a host of creative tools. The industry continues to move faster than ever, and the need for our expertise, our technology, and our people has never been greater. We are a production's best ally every step of the way. **#OneCastOneCrew**

**About Cast & Crew**  

We grew from a modest small business in 1976 to be the premiere provider of entertainment technology and solutions, staying true to our mission of modernizing content production and leading the digital transformation within the industry. Our cloud-based solutions and industry expertise help streamline the entire production lifecycle and have revolutionized how content is made. We now have a global workforce across a host of storied brands, spanning all areas of produced and live entertainment, from film, television, streaming, to advertising, live events, and short-form.



**About the Role**



The Salesforce Administrator will play a vital role within our Salesforce Support Team. We are seeking a proactive individual that can help continually improve and enhance our Salesforce platform, gather requirements, design scalable best practice solutions, and effectively meet the demanding needs of the Salesforce project. The ideal candidate will be able to work effectively on Lightning Platform with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Experience Cloud, and be highly proficient in configuring within the lightning platform using flow builder and other Salesforce configuration tools.



The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the Salesforce platform, best practices, and can effectively support our current setup and our business objectives.


**Key Duties & Responsibilities:**



This is a varied technical and business facing role, with the following responsibilities:


* All aspects of user and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules
* Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, milestones, assignment rules, approval processes, custom objects, lightning record pages, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, custom metadata, mobile administration, reports and dashboards
* Understanding of basic triggers/Apex code knowledge
* Sandbox environment management
* DevOps/release management experience
* Identify and gather requirements, translating into best practice, scalable solutions with a focus on exceptional user experience
* Identify unused or underutilized platform solutions
* Create roadmaps and set priorities, working closely with Salesforce manager and stakeholders
* Own the communication of platform changes to end users and stakeholders
* Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed
* Proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer
* Daily user support Issues for a community of over 400 users
* Monitor and improve user adoption
* Ongoing user training
* Technical and business documentation
* Management of integrated applications including but not limited to Okta, OwnBackup, Five9, zAgile, Cloudingo and Conga


**Skills and Experience Required:**


* Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or equivalent
* Salesforce Certifications (Administrator or Advanced Administrator)
* Expertise in Salesforce best practices across the platform, including third party applications
* 5+ years of experience in Salesforce Administration
* 5+ years of experience in computer software admin/development in a company environment
* Experience in implementation and configuration of Sales, Service, Marketing and Experience Cloud
* Excellent ability to work in cross-functional teams
* Must be able to support users in a "helpdesk-like" environment as well as in a project based one
* Regularly evaluate new Salesforce features and third-party solutions and explain benefits and risks
* Strong communication, presentation, and writing skills
* Strong project and process background
* Plans and carries out responsibilities with minimal direction
* Must be able to work in a fast pace with high level of accuracy
* Must be a fast learner
* Background in client account management, with a focus on the Entertainment sector (Major Studios preferred - big plus)


**Special Work Conditions**


* Sedentary – Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Some positions may entail exerting up to 15 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force to lift, carry, push, or pull.

  

Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs. Compensation range for candidates in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location.**The compensation range for this position is:**


$100,000—$115,000 USD**Benefits**



Cast & Crew provides a comprehensive package of employee benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, health and wellness programs, employee discounts, and more! Note: Cast & Crew benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.



Due to the high volume of applicants, it is likely that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  

  

CA residents: Your personal information may be collected in connection with certain services provided by Cast & Crew or its affiliated companies. A summary of your California privacy rights can be found at: https://www.castandcrew.com/privacy-policy/



Cast & Crew is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

title: System Administrator
description:
**Introduction to Briefly**


Briefly, is a support organization, professionally running the back-office operations of a tech-enabled, highly selective, global law firm consistently recognized for its excellence, innovation, and teamwork throughout its 45 offices in 14 countries and five continents. This disruptive business model has widely become known amongst the most innovative in the legal industry prioritizing collaboration, dynamic innovation, consistent excellence, agility, and efficiency. These core principles provide our firm with an insightful understanding of how we can continue to push our growth year over year.


**Position Summary:**

We are currently seeking a full-time, highly skilled System Administrator to join our dynamic legal firm's IT team. The ideal candidate will possess expertise in Azure Active Directory group management, telecom, data migration, Citrix, software packaging, endpoint imaging, and security development. As a System Administrator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and efficiency of our IT infrastructure to meet the unique needs of our legal practice. This position is a fully remote opportunity.

**Essential Functions & Responsibilities**

* A problem solver, that can act as technical project lead, manage workload and complete tasks on time.
* Experience in the support of mid-large-scale environments, multi-users, multi-site.
* Experience in the support of a remote work force, networks and PCs.

* Windows Deployment Technologies - Imaging, Sysprep, Provisioning Packages, DISM
