* Can provide complete lifecycle support of existing and new environments including maintenance, software updates, troubleshooting, vulnerability management and remediation.
* Phone VOIP - Knowledge of MS Voice and Ring Central
* Experience with RBRO, iManage Work, iManage SPM,
* Experience with data management solutions and data migration processes.
* Assist in research and procurement of firm wide software and hardware solutions.
* Familiar with using PowerShell for automation
* Administer IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS based enterprise applications.
* Document processes and troubleshooting steps for knowledge base articles utilized by other IT Support members.
* Communicate with users to understand, identify, document, and resolve problems.
* Provide telephone, in-person, and online support to end-users.
* Coordinate activities with the IT leaders.

**Essential Capabilities**

**Azure Active Directory Groups:**

* Design, implement, manage, and maintain Azure Active Directory groups and policies to streamline and ensure proper access controls and permissions.
* Ensure proper integration of endpoint devices with Azure AD for seamless authentication and access control.
* Troubleshoot Azure AD-related issues and implement necessary improvements.
* Manage Azure Active Directory groups, ensuring accurate user access and permissions.
* Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate Azure Active Directory with other systems and applications.
* Monitor and respond to security incidents related to Azure Active Directory.
* Design and manage Azure Active Directory groups to streamline access control and permissions.
* Collaborate with IT administrators to ensure AAD groups align with organizational policies and legal compliance requirements.

 **Endpoint Troubleshooting and Support:**

* Provide advanced technical support for endpoint-related issues, collaborating with the IT support team to resolve incidents promptly.
* Develop and maintain documentation for troubleshooting procedures and best practices.

 **Endpoint Management:**

* Familiarity with the development, implementation, and management of endpoint strategies and solutions for endpoint configuration, deployment, and troubleshooting.
* Familiarity with software packaging and deployment.
* Knowledge in supporting legal-specific software and applications.

**Collaboration and Communication:**

* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, legal, and security teams, to align endpoint strategies with organizational goals.
* Communicate effectively with end-users, providing training and documentation as needed.

 **Documentation and Training:**

* Create comprehensive documentation for system processes and management, network diagrams and configurations.
* Provide knowledge transfer for IT staff and end-users as required.

 **Education & Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell for automation.
* Proven experience in software packaging, endpoint imaging, and security development.
* In-depth knowledge of software packaging tools, endpoint imaging processes, and security best practices.
* Hands-on experience with Azure Active Directory, group management, and integration.
* Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
* Experience in supporting law firms preferred.

**Job Related Competencies**

* Technical capabilities as described above
* Solution oriented
* Attention to detail
* Customer focused
* Ability to work independently
* Commitment to operational improvements and efficiency
* Integrity
* Leadership
* Strategic Thinking

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Briefly, Inc. is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable law. Our firm values diversity and inclusion, fostering an environment where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Discrimination or harassment based on any protected characteristic is strictly prohibited. We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply for opportunities within our firm.

**Accommodation for Applicants with Disabilities**


Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Briefly. If you have a disability or special need and need assistance participating in the application process, please let us know.

**E-Verify**


This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your form I-9 information to confirm you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Learning Management System Administrator
description:
**About Sound:**

  



Headquartered in Tacoma, WA, Sound Physicians is a physician-founded and led, national, multi-specialty medical group made up of more than 1,000 business colleagues and 4,000 physicians, APPs, CRNAs, and nurses practicing in 400-plus hospitals across 45 states. Founded in 2001, and with specialties in emergency and hospital medicine, critical care, anesthesia, and telemedicine, Sound has a reputation for innovating and leading through an ever-changing healthcare landscape — with patients at the center of the universe.

  


**Sound Physicians offers a competitive benefits package inclusive of the items below, and more:**


* Medical insurance, Dental insurance, and Vision insurance
* Health care and dependent care flexible spending account
* 401(k) retirement savings plan with a company match
* Paid time off (PTO) begins accruing immediately upon start date at a rate of 15 days per year, in accordance with Sound's PTO policy
* Ten company-paid holidays per year

  


**About Our Team**



The Recruiting and People Development team provides Sound Physicians colleagues with innovative, forward-thinking, and practical people solutions in recruiting, onboarding, learning and leadership development, coaching, performance, and talent planning (Talent Reviews, Succession Planning, and Emerging Leader programs).


**Our Team MISSION:** We come to the table, as a partner, to build relationships, promote diversity of thought, and ignite excitement to create lasting impressions in healthcare.


**Our Team VISION:** Innovate to elevate our Most Valuable Resource – Our Sound Colleagues


**We are FUN:** Yes, self-proclaimed but can be verified.

  


**About the Role**



We are looking for a Learning Management System (LMS) administrator to collaborate with the People Development team and Sound Physicians stakeholders nationwide to support our learning and leadership initiatives. This position reports to the Senior People Development Partner while supporting the People Development team. **In this role you have three primary areas of focus:**

  


**The Details:** This is a virtual, work-from-home opportunity.

  


**Product Manager (Technical):**


* Manage and administer the Cornerstone OnDemand learning management system, including the ongoing design, configuration, testing, deployment, and end-user training for the Sound network.
* Continue to improve and develop the modern learning user interface in the learning portal and mobile learning app using adult learning best practices.
* Continuously evaluate tools/processes to ensure Sound has the best-in-class user experience that offers efficient, high-quality, and seamless learning.
* Build and maintain a strategic relationship with LMS vendor ensuring Sound’s LMS is current, compliant, and working as designed to help minimize/mitigate any technical issues between our systems.
* Provide technical troubleshooting support to Sound stakeholders as related to learning programs and LMS features.
* Manage learning catalog management to ensure current, compliant, and relevant learning content is available within Sound Institute (Cornerstone).
* Manage Cornerstone’s role-based access, communication, and training to colleagues with access to ensure they are fully equipped to support their teams.

  


**Reporting and Analytics:**


* Drive data, analytics, and reporting needs proactively for business stakeholders to drive decision making and/or provide valid, actionable insights based on learning effectiveness measures.
* Establish and maintain a robust reporting framework, gather key analytics to create data visualizations, and have Domain knowledge.

  


**Learning Design and Development:**


* Create innovative, functional learning solutions with streamlined processes to solve challenges and meet the needs of the customer (ILT, vILT, eLearning blended solutions).
* Ability to exercise latitude to determine best learning solution approach.
* Develop content focused on healthcare regulatory requirements and general compliance – internal/external facing.
* Assist with virtual production support (Teams, Adobe Connect, and Zoom)
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment while delivering high-quality work on time.
* Serve as peer mentor and/or coach to learning colleagues and members of the Sound network, providing one-on-one training, as well as in-person/virtual Sound professional development training sessions.

  


**What we are looking for:**

  



A successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of a combination of these values, knowledge, and experience:

  


**Values:**


* **Self-motivated:** Proactively jumps in to start a task or project with limited direction; asks to take on more responsibility and what’s next.
* **Driven:** Motivated to succeed and get things done at a high level of achievement.
* **Intellectually curious:** Demonstrates a genuine interest in learning new things and wants to know the reason “why” behind the way things are done.
* **Persistent:** Demonstrates the ability to “keep at it” even when obstacles or challenges are present; returns to the work at hand after a change of course.
* **Resourceful:** Proactive willingness to utilize available information and tools to figure things out.

  


**Knowledge:**


* Thorough knowledge of web-based content development and deployment systems, Learning Management Systems (LMS) or Learning Content Management Systems (LCMS) experience.
* Adult Learning Theory (e.g., readiness to learn, orientation to learning, learning experience).
* Bachelor’s Degree in HR, Training, Computer Science, or related field of study and/or 4 years of experience in related field accepted.
* Knowledge of Audience and Training Needs Assessment best practices and processes.
* People, Process, Programs, and System Integrations: understand all the data, dependencies and integration across the learning people experience.
* Design Thinking / User-Centric approach to solution design and implementation
* Proficiency in Articulate 360
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop and Adobe Premier Pro
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, and Power Point
* Analytical skills in validating data as well as quickly performing ad hoc analysis

  


**Experience:**


* 4+ years’ experience working with Learning Management Systems (preferred Cornerstone)
* Experience in data, analytics, and reporting
* Experience in instructional design in developing learning content based on best adult learning theories and delivery modalities (e.g., blending learning, micro- and social learning)
* A successful record in the design of blended learning experiences that include simulations, games, video, just-in-time learning solutions, job aids and infographics, and animation/motion graphics
* Experience working in the Healthcare industry (preferred)
* Experience developing training modules requiring technical writing/regulatory content
* Proven ability to effectively collaborate, influence and build trusted partnership with People Development Team
* Ability to work in an agile and iterative way in a fast paced and collaborative environment

  


*Sound Physicians is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion at the bedside and in our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.*

  


*This job description reflects the present requirements of the position. As duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to amendment.*

title: System Administrator
description:
At Advantive, we make purpose-built software for specialty manufacturing and distribution businesses that streamline complex processes, optimize operations visibility and throughput, and drive improved quality, profitability, and revenue growth. Deeply embedded in our customers’ businesses, Advantive’s software solutions add value along the full manufacturing and distribution lifecycle.



Our customers, who include corrugated and packaging manufacturers, equipment and supply wholesale distributors, and automotive and other specialty manufacturers, benefit from our solutions that have been honed over decades in the marketplace. We know our customers’ businesses intimately and deliver software to address their needs.


**Summary -**

As a System Administrator at Advantive, you'll leverage your technical expertise to administer and optimize IT systems, ensuring their reliability, security, and performance. Your responsibilities will include deploying and configuring system components, monitoring system health, and promptly addressing any issues or anomalies. You'll collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide effective solutions, while also documenting processes and procedures for internal reference. Additionally, you'll play a key role in implementing automation solutions, and integrating tools to enhance system efficiency and streamline workflows. Your commitment to operational excellence and adherence to IT best practices will contribute to maintaining a culture of discipline and efficiency within the organization.

  


**Job Description**


**Responsibilities:**


* Administer, maintain, configure, and ensure the reliable operation of a Microsoft 365 tenant serving 500+ end users
* Manage Microsoft Exchange, including configuring mail flow, mailbox management, security settings, and overall support within the Microsoft 365 Exchange Online environment
* Administration of Microsoft SharePoint Online including configuration of security permissions, Site and document library setup, permissions auditing and the general operation and support of Microsoft 365 SharePoint Online
* Utilize scripting and automation to optimize workflow efficiency and enhance system performance within the Microsoft 365 environment
* Deploy, maintain, and configure company-issued personal computers using Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune), encompassing software deployment, patch management, and inventory tracking

 * Manage virtualization technologies such as VMware and Hyper-V
* Maintain and support databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL), ensuring data integrity, performance, and security
* Provide documentation and technical specifications to IT staff for planning and implementing new IT systems and infrastructure upgrades
* Oversee backup operations and establish suitable processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures
* Provide End users support, including hardware and software troubleshooting, documentation of issues and resolutions, as part of the helpdesk, and ensuring timely resolution of problems with minimal disruptions.


**Qualifications:**


* Associate or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, System Administration, or a closely related field, or equivalent experience required
* 5+ years of system administration experience
* Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, Exchange, and SharePoint administration
* Advanced expertise in scripting languages and automation
* Proficiency in Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)
* Strong skills in hardware and software troubleshooting, issue documentation, and helpdesk support for end users
* System administration and IT certifications in Microsoft, or other network related fields are a plus


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Qualified applicants will be asked to complete a 30-minute online assessment as a part of your application.

title: System Administrator
description:
**Job Description:**

One of our clients is looking for a System Administrator. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing our server infrastructure, including server administration, domain administration, SQL server administration, and antivirus administration. They will also be involved in server and workstation upgrades and application and platform integration.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Server Administration:** Manage and maintain Microsoft Windows servers, including installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
* **Domain Administration:** Manage and maintain Active Directory, including user and group management, Group Policy, and domain controller maintenance.
* **SQL Server Administration:** Administer Microsoft SQL databases, including installation, configuration, backup and recovery, and performance tuning.
* **Server and Workstation Upgrades:** Manage the upgrade process for servers and workstations, ensuring minimal disruption to services.
* **Antivirus Administration:** Manage Sophos antivirus solutions, ensuring all systems are protected and up-to-date.
* **Application and Platform Integration:** Integrate various applications and platforms using APIs, and manage Zoom VOIP services.

**Required Skills and Experience:**

* Proficient in Microsoft Windows server management and SQL administration
* Familiarity with HP and Dell server and workstation hardware
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office and Office 365
* Experience with VMware and VSphere 6.7/V7
* Proficient in Zoom VOIP
* Understanding of application APIs

**Education:**

* A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is required. Relevant certifications, such as MCSE or VCP, are highly desirable.

**Experience:**

* A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role is required.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55.00 - $65.00 per hour

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* On call

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Microsoft Windows Server: 5 years (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Administrator

One of our clients is looking for a Network Administrator. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing our network infrastructure, including network administration, firewall administration, and security reviews and assessments.

title: Operational System Administrator/ Cloud Engineer
description:
**Operations System Administrator/ Cloud Engineer**
**iDoxSolutions**, a **B&A** company with a history dating back to 1993. We foster and embrace a distinct set of values that we live by and instill in all aspects of our organization: dedication, commitment, partnership, trust, and recognition. We have incorporated these values into successful delivery for our customers since 1993. We believe in ensuring the employees feel deeply connected to the organization, recognizing successes and hard work, and providing continuous opportunities to learn and grow.
Our people are entrepreneurial thinkers that combine mindset, vision, and experience to drive value – not only to us as an organization, but to the clients we support. Together we promote a collaborative culture with our clients, and with each other, as one team working towards a common vision. We would love for you to join our team!
**Job Summary**
iDoxSolutions has a requirement for an experienced Operations Systems Administrator to provide support for an established installation of an AppWorks/Content Server cloud-based application.
**Responsibilities**
* Monitor and maintain specific system operations.
* Deploy patches and new versions of software.
* Edit listing of SOPs and problem resolution logs.
* Provide feedback in lessons learned and implement changes.
* Record and document incidents and incident resolutions.
* Deploy and maintain thick- and thin-client applications.
* Train end-users on new features and processes.
* Troubleshoot end-user issues.
* Participate in planning, development and deployment meetings with development staff.
* Provide helpdesk and maintenance support to End-users.
* Detailed Knowledge of Amazon Web Services/ Gov Cloud and the ability to perform administrative maintenance and issue resolution.


**Education and Experience**
* BS or equivalent experience in Computer Science or other technical field.


**Required Skills**
* Requires knowledge of workflow processes, internal system operations and component services (file servers, db servers, AWS servers, process agents, internet servers, scan stations).
* Updating technical documentation for submission to approving teams as well as day-to-day maintenance of a cloud-based infrastructure.
* Knowledge to perform daily, weekly and periodic updates and maintenance operations to production, development and backup systems.
* Assist with operations related Helpdesk tickets, to answer questions and troubleshoot system, group and end-user issues.
* Experience with Basic system operations: member/group creation, worklist and document workflow monitoring, system health and space requirements.
* Ability to perform and check system backups.
* Familiarity and/or experience with the use of system logging & monitoring tools.
* Demonstrated experience with delivering web-based applications and dealing with the challenges of compatibility, scalability, and performance
* Familiarity with server, PC and NAS hardware and their maintenance
* Expertise in documenting administrative functions and processes
* Expertise in analyzing workflow solutions
* End-to-end understanding of development processes, organization, and techniques in order to drive the creation of optimal solutions
  

**Desired Skills**
* Experience Content Server/Livelink administration duties.
* Provide plans and schedules (MS Project) to program manager for identified projects.
* Ability to use standard problem solving techniques to diagnose system irregularities and problems.
* Knowledge of QA procedures.
* Provide test plans for new applications.
* Provide basic documentation/training materials for new applications.
* Ability to multi-task several issues simultaneously and rank according to severity.
* Ideally familiarity w PostgreSQL data functionality
* Ideally familiarity w Open Text products such as AppWorks and Content Server


**Basic Skills**
* Ability to research and report on a variety of issues: identified problem areas, potential problem areas, new hardware and software.
* Liaison with outside vendors of third-party software and hardware.
* Monitor contracts for technical support and maintenance.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Work under pressure and at speed to minimize the impact to end-users of system planned and unplanned issues.
* Willingness to learn system specifics.
* Ability to maintain a ‘toolbox’ of solutions and to recognized patterns in troubleshooting and helpdesk support.
* Maintain records and documentation of actions and procedures.
* Organizational skills.


**Security Clearance**
* **Ability to obtain a security clearance- Public Trust.**


**More About iDox:**
***Notable Clients***  

iDox has grown to be a company that is trusted by our clients for exceptional service, innovative solutions, and inspired employees. Our service extends through federal, state, and local Government, the private sector, and higher education. Some of our notable clients include Department of Justice, FDA and Army.
***Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion***
iDox affirms its long-standing commitment to maintain a diverse workforce reflective of the communities in which it operates, strives to maintain a business culture that recognizes the contributions and interests of diverse cultural and social groups, and seeks to maximize employee efforts by understanding individual differences and perspectives.
***Benefits and Programs***  

iDox is proud to offer full time employees a 100% premium paid medical plan option, which includes coverage for medical, prescription, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, disability, Teladoc, and accident insurance. In addition to these benefits, iDox employees enjoy paid time off, tuition assistance, iDox sponsored trainings and certifications, commuter transit benefits (SmartBenefits) for DC Metro full-time employees and a free subscription to a virtual exercise platform (NEOU).
iDox has launched several programs to focus on employee engagement, wellness, and assistance.
These include:
* The iDox Cares program: on-staff registered counselor, 30/60/90-day wellness check ins, personal development, financial management, and stress management seminars, wellness challenges, and more
* A formal mentorship program
* Job shadowing and cross training opportunities
* Brand Ambassador program
* Lifeworks Employee Assistance Program (EAP): engagement through guided wellness and peer recognition. Access to various support resources to include counseling, legal guidance, financial planning, and more
* Monthly virtual events
* iDox Annual Wellness Challenge: #StepWithiDox, #WalkDuringLunchWithiDox, #VolunteeringWithiDox, and #ExerciseDuringLunchWithiDox, and more


At iDox, we place significant importance on improving the communities and lives of citizens across the nation through our involvement, technology expertise, and employees. iDox puts an emphasis on charitable efforts in the Northern Virginia area, including Capital Area Food Bank pantry drives, book donations, Hope for Henry Foundation events, and many more. In recognition of all these efforts, iDox has been named a Companies as Responsive Employers (CARE) award recipient by Northern Virginia Family Services and nominated by the Northern Virginia Chamber of Commerce for Outstanding Corporate Citizenship Award.
**EEO**
iDox provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. iDox complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy covers conduct occurring at iDox’s offices, and other workplaces (including client sites) and all other locations where iDox is providing services, and to all work-related activities.
EEO is the Law
**Affirmative Action Plan**
As a federal government contractor and based on Executive Orders and applicable laws and regulations, iDox develops and maintains annual written Affirmative Action Plans and endeavors to hire and advance qualified minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans.
iDox participates in e-Verify. We provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee’s I-9 Form to confirm work authorization.

title: IT Systems Administrator/Manager
description:
IT Systems Administrator/Manager (Google Workspace, App Sheet/App Script)

**About Neuro-Development of Words, LLC**  is an educational technology organization that offers 1:1 and small-group evidence-based literacy services with live, online, highly-trained instructors for all ages. The methodology is based on the latest scientific research regarding neural plasticity (efficient, long-lasting learning). Our methodology is research-and evidence-based and peer-reviewed. Our programs address difficulties with reading and spelling, comprehension, writing, and math including Dyslexia and other Learning Disorders.

**Learn more about us:**

* Our Programs: https://www.nowprograms.com/
* You Tube: https://www.youtube.com/@nowcompany3096/videos
* Our CEO Dr. Conway at TEDx Ocala: https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=M4LtozMLMNc

**Job Description:**

We're currently in search of an IT Systems Administrator/Manager. This vital role involves the entire Google Workspace realm—a collection of cloud-based tools for boosting productivity and collaboration. From managing user accounts to email and calendar setup, you'll also be the guardian of our digital security. If you're well-versed in Google Workspace, have experience in Google App Sheets and App Script and have a solid background in IT administration, we would love to hear from you.

Responsibilities

* Develop and build tools for use by our team in Google App Sheet, utilizing App Script.
* User Accounts and Access Management: Handle user accounts and permissions, ensuring everyone has the right access while maintaining security.
* Efficient Communication Setup: Oversee the configuration and setup of Gmail, Google Drive, and Google Messaging.
* Data Security Oversight: Implement security measures and protocols to keep our systems and information safe from potential threats.
* Provide technical support to employees and assist with technology training and onboarding as needed.
* Technical Problem Solver: Tackle technical challenges head-on, troubleshooting and fixing issues to keep operations running smoothly.
* Proficiently utilize computers, software, and technologies used by the and stay up to date with the latest updates, add-ons, and capabilities of Maintaining the company's IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, work operating systems, workspaces, and other systems.
* Ensure that all systems are up-to-date and running smoothly, and troubleshoot any issues that arise.
* Implement and maintain security protocols to protect the company's data and ensure compliance with industry regulations.
* Monitor system performance and make recommendations for improvements.
* Maintain IT policies and procedures to ensure consistency and adherence to best practices.
* Collaborate with NOW! staff to identify opportunities for growth and improvement in our technology products and services.
* Undertake additional technology projects and initiatives as assigned by the leadership team.

Salary: (DOE) Depends on Experience

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Google Workspace Administration: 3 years (Preferred)
* Google Script: 3 years (Preferred)
* Google App Sheets: 3 years (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Confidential (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
**Linux System Administrator**

 **Job Location: 100% Remote**

 **Job Description:**


As a Linux systems administrator, you will manage, build, and troubleshoot physical and virtual servers using Red Hat Linux Operating Systems. Perform administrative operations and maintenance functions of linux server hardware and software. You will be responsible for deployment, configuration, and life cycle management of the Linux platforms. You will provide support for system hardening to DOD security standards.


An understanding of DoD and government security standards and policies are needed to ensure all deployed changes are highly secure and available.

**Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of systems administration experience working in an enterprise environment (DOD environment highly preferred).
* 5+ years of experience with Red Hat Linux systems administration and maintenance.
* Hands on experience with system hardening and implementation of DISA STIGs.
* Ability to work with stakeholders including management and development teams in defining requirements.
* Capable of interpreting vulnerability reports and defining executable actions that should be taken to reduce vulnerabilities and risks with proven ability to perform in-depth analysis on patch requirements, migrations in Linux environments, and build an action plan that will address vulnerabilities.
* Familiarity with VMWare and SAN management and concepts

**Typical Duties/Abilities:**

* Active Directory domain administration to include Group Policy deployment, management, and troubleshooting.
* Maintain system documentation and develop new documentation for system configurations, procedures, and best practices.
* Analyze and monitor system performance and capacity, proactively identifying and resolving issues.
* Validating and implementing critical system patches.
* Create, deploy, and administer file servers and shares for functionality in hybrid environments.
* Assist with network troubleshooting and resolutions on LAN and WAN connections.
* Assists with the scheduling, planning, and oversight of system upgrades.
* Assists in planning upgrades and replacements for program assets upon reaching their end-of-life cycle.
* Supports requirements gathering and asset acquisition for new programs of work.
* Supports team leadership as required and ensures customer requirements and project milestones are met.

**Soft Skills**

* Experience working with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Business Analysts)
* Strong communication and collaboration skills with a track record of taking solution ownership.
* Communication skills key! Demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate with leadership and key stakeholders.
* Ability to articulate design and configuration choices and bring about consensus.

**Education/Certifications:**

* BS degree in Information Technology or another related technical discipline.

**\\*\\*MUST BE A US CITIZEN AND BE ABLE TO COMPLETE THE GOVERNMENT'S BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION\\*\\***

title: Systems Administrator
description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Systems Administrator to join our IT team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Microsoft 365 administration and general IT support. Experience and knowledge in cybersecurity principles and ISO 27000 standards are a big plus. Additionally, this role involves responsibilities in data reporting and collection. This is a dynamic position that offers the opportunity to work on a variety of IT tasks and projects, providing essential support to our IT infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities:

* Manage and maintain Microsoft 365 services, ensuring efficient operation and user support.
* Support in implementing and managing cybersecurity measures in line with company policies and industry best practices.
* Assist in maintaining compliance with ISO 27000 series standards, particularly focusing on information security management.
* Conduct regular data collection and reporting, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery of insights.
* Collaborate with other departments to identify and meet their data and IT service needs.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting to users.
* Ensure IT documentation of systems, processes, and user guidelines is kept up-to-date.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience.
* 1-3 years of experience in systems administration, with a focus on Microsoft 365 administration.
* Experience in data reporting and collection.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
* Willingness to continuously learn and adapt to new technologies.
* Knowledge/experience of ISO 27000 series standards and cybersecurity is a big plus.

title: Mainframe Systems Database Administrator – QREP
description:
Position Summary



Provide DB2 Data Replication support and services to Ensono clients as it relates to Mainframe and LUW DB2 systems through product implementation and deployment. The successful candidate will provide support for QREP administration work in relation to MQueues, Subscriptions, Publications and QMAPS, also development, administration and tuning to support our clients’ development, test and production environments. The individual will be responsible for day-to-day Mainframe and LUW QREP administration work and database maintenance such as creating and maintaining MQueues, subscriptions, publications, QMAPS, and maintaining DR procedures and overall support of client needs and requests. The successful candidate will be called upon to perform various database optimizations that will include general reporting and analysis of the database replication configuration’s efficiency and periodic review of database performance.


Position reports to Manager Information Technology, Info Sys.


Key Areas of Focus for this Role


* Work on QREP – start, stop, create, drop or alter the MQueues, Subscriptions, Publications, QMAPS and stop or start Capture and Apply process as needed
* Expertise and work efforts will focus on the development and support and/or the customization of new services and support efforts.
* The individual will need to work with vendor personnel to achieve timely solutions of database replication problems.
* Fulfill client requests and change orders for mainframe z/OS clients in a timely manner as they pertain to Q Replication.
* Provide primary support for reported problems related to client QREP issues.
* Provide support on 24 x 7 x 365 basis across multiple time zones and participate in on-call responsibilities.
* Assist the assigned project manager in the migration of newly acquired clients such that all technical hurdles are addressed in a timely manner and do not impede the expected progress of the transition nor the targeted migration date.
* In joint cooperation with the Disaster Recovery Services, successfully execute tasks associated with any given client’s disaster recovery plans.
* Follow ITSM change control procedures


What the Ideal Candidate Brings to this Role


*Required Qualifications help to assure new Associates are set up for success in their role with Ensono. To be considered for this career opportunity, it is important that you meet all Required Qualifications. Candidates that may meet some, but not all, Other Qualifications are still encouraged to apply.*


**Required Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree required and/or equivalent work experience.
* 10 years of professional experience in QREP DB2 for administration and application support.
* Extensive experience with the following:
	+ Administrating and supporting databases as QREP DBA on Mainframe DB2 and LUW DB2
	+ Support multiple DB2 subsystems simultaneously
	+ Experience in Replication setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting
	+ Supporting client and internal requests for building all types of DB2 objects.
	+ Analyzing new versions of DB2 for functionality that can improve client’s systems
	+ Refreshing test data for whole environments
	+ Supporting DB2 security requests
	+ Review DB2 security to find potential risks
	+ Reorganization of application data
	+ Vendor consultations for problems and questions
	+ Space calculations for new objects and environments
	+ Reviewing, tuning of internal DB2 buffer pools and SQL code
	+ DR recovery of application objects
	+ Experience solving issues related to MQ subscriptions, capture and apply process

**Other Qualifications**


* Experience with DataStudio, CA, BMC, and IBM tools for DB2, MQ
* Experience establishing policies and procedures pertaining to database management, DR, security, maintenance and utilization preferred
* Supporting multiple clients after hours on-call
* Self-motivated and able to work independently.
* Must be able to multi-task and work under short deadlines and in high pressure situations.
* Excellent communication skills (written, verbal and presentations)
* Ability to work as part of a team, as well as independently.


Why Ensono?



Ensono is a place we unleash Associates to ***Do Great Things*** – for our clients and for your career. This could mean achieving a professional goal, collaborating with your team on an innovative idea, learning a new skill, reaching a wellness milestone, or engaging in your community through volunteer programs. Whatever it means to you, we want Ensono to be the place where you can do great things.


* We value flexibility and work-life balance. Positions that are not required to be onsite to support a client may offer the ability to work remotely or hybrid at an Ensono office location.
* Unlimited Paid Day Off (PDO) Plan
* Two robust health plan options through Blue Cross Blue Shield
* 401(k) with a generous company match
* Eligibility for dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life and AD&D coverage, and flexible spending accounts
* Depending on location, ability to take advantage of fitness centers
* Wellness program
* Flexible work schedule


Ensono is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to providing equal employment to our Associates and building a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.


Pay transparency nondiscrimination statement/posting OFCCP’s pay transparency policy can be found on OFCCP’s website.


If you need accommodation at any point during the application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email USTalentAcquisition@esnono.com.

title: Linux/Unix Administrator.
description: Project Description This person will be primarily responsible for our Linux/Unix environment. This includes patching, new server provisioning, and break/fix. Responsibilities Linux access modifications, Linux OS Administration, security vulnerabilities remediation, Ansible responsibilities, and management of infrastructure to support Containers (IE, Kubernetes) Skills Must have • 5 + Linux OS installation, configuration, and troubleshooting • 5+ years of Linux experience in multiple distributions/editions • 2+ management of infrastructure to support Containers (IE, Kubernetes) • 3+ years of hands-on experience with VMware platforms • Automation and/or experience maintaining Container environments • Healthcare-specific background, Telecommute experience, Automation background Nice to have • Healthcare Industry experience

title: Systems Engineer (Remote)
description:
Since 1978, ACS Technologies (“ACST”) has served the faith-based community, building software to help ministries lead with less stress and more accuracy. ACST enables churches to handle every vital area of their ministry from finances to relationships. We're now the leader in the industry but we've got more work to do, and we need the right talent on board to help with our mission of serving churches with tomorrow's technology.


The Systems Engineer (SEM) provides assistance in implementation, testing, debugging, documenting, and the management of Managed Services customer facing systems and devices. The SEM also integrates data across these systems to meet the dynamic needs of the business. The SEM is accountable for maintaining approved standards and quality within his/her team and contributing to these across all teams. The SEM is responsible for resolving standard and high level issues while increasing his or her technical know-how and expertise. **What You’ll Do:*** Independently resolves standard level customer issues, assists on projects, provides technical expertise, and contributes to the IT community.
* Maintains and improves quality of customer facing systems.
* Monitors and implements preventative actions to keep unplanned downtime at a minimum.
* Researches and implements updates and upgrades as appropriate.
* Documents systems administered in a timely, accurate manner and maintains appropriate visibility in managed systems.
* Assists in implementing new and better tools and methodologies.

 **What We’re Looking For:*** BS in Computer Science or related, with 3-5 years of systems administration or engineering experience, or an equivalent mix of education and experience.
* Has experience in at least one of the three areas below, with proven working knowledge in the remaining:
	+ Server and or systems administration
	+ Network administration
	+ 3rd party cloud computing design and implementation
* Experience with ConnectWise is preferred, specifically ConnectWise Manage (PSA) and ConnectWise Automate.
* Proven technical skills and the ability to communicate technical ideas to diverse individuals.
* Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in Windows and Apple operating systems. Most experience with Apple would be a plus.

 **Why You Want to Work Here:*** Outstanding benefits package, including 6% 401(k) match
* Free Wellness Clinic staffed by a Nurse Practitioner
* A caring, friendly work environment
* The opportunity to positively impact ministries

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: System Administrator
description:
**About us**

Thank you for considering employment opportunities with SoftOrbits. We kindly request that you refrain from submitting job applications via Indeed, as we are currently inundated with a high volume of messages through this platform, making it difficult to process them efficiently.

To ensure that your job application receives proper attention and consideration, we encourage you to submit it directly through our official website. Please follow these steps:

* Access the **SoftOrbits** website by searching for it using a search engine such as **Google**.
* Scroll to the footer section of the website.
* Click on the **Careers** link provided.
* Complete and submit your job request.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Growth opportunities
* Work-from-home days
* Administer and maintain network infrastructure, including both Windows and Linux systems, ensuring their reliability, security, and performance.
* Configure, install, and manage network hardware and software components, such as routers, switches, firewalls, and servers, to support organizational requirements.
* Monitor network activity, analyze performance data, and troubleshoot issues to identify and resolve network-related problems in a timely manner.
* Implement and maintain network security measures, including access controls, encryption, and intrusion detection systems, to protect against unauthorized access and data breaches.
* Collaborate with IT teams and departmental stakeholders to design and implement network solutions that meet business needs and align with strategic objectives.
* Document network configurations, procedures, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in network administration to continuously improve network infrastructure and operations.

**Experience:**

* Proven experience as a network administrator or similar role, with expertise in both Windows and Linux environments.
* Proficiency in administering and troubleshooting network devices and protocols, such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, and VPNs.
* Strong understanding of network security principles and practices, including firewalls, VPNs, encryption, and vulnerability management.
* Familiarity with virtualization technologies, cloud computing platforms, and containerization solutions is a plus.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills to work closely with team members and stakeholders.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $55.00 - $70.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Remote

title: Systems Administrator - Contract
description:
**About Telestream**


For over 25 years, Telestream has been the undisputed trailblazer of innovation in the digital video industry. We craft cutting edge solutions for every facet of media processing and workflow orchestration. Whether it's the adrenaline-pumping live capture, seamless streaming, awe-inspiring production, or meticulous quality assurance of video content - Telestream stands as the unyielding force that ensures your video reaches audiences flawlessly, no matter how they are created, disseminated, or consumed.

  

Our roster of customers include most of the top Media & Entertainment, Video Production, Broadcasting and streaming companies in the world.

  

Now is the time for the next phase of Telestream's growth as we help our customers move to the next generation of video products and solutions that not only take advantage of traditional on premises solutions but are now moving to more hybrid and cloud based technologies and business solutions, while also incorporating AI into their video workflows.  



  

**Systems Administrator**

  

Job Type: Contract  



  

Location: USA - Remote. Quarterly travel to corporate locations.

  

In this role, you will be part of our Site Reliability Group, supporting our Customer Facing Production Platform. You will be responsible for architecting, building, and maintaining the technical infrastructure, systems, and applications.  



  

  

**Responsibilities**:

* Manage and maintain the cloud infrastructure services (AWS, Azure, & GCP) and servers in a mixed software environment (Windows and Linux)
* Design, write, and build tools to improve the reliability, latency, availability, and scalability of the platform
* Participate in capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis, and system tuning.
* Debug of system and infrastructure errors and bottlenecks.
* Secure the platform.
* Participate in on-call rotation.

 **Minimum qualifications:**

* Experience in the fields of Computer Science or Software Engineering
* Experience programming in one or more languages: C, C++, Java, Python, or Go
* Managing and maintaining a production environment
* Managing and maintaining a systems at scale in cloud based environments

 **Preferred qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in a relevant STEM field (e.g., Information Systems, Information Technology, Applied Networking, System Administration, Computer Science, Engineering).
* Expertise in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
* Understanding of Unix/Linux operating systems.
* Understanding of containerization and container platforms (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, EKS)
* Experience using cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services/AWS, Google Cloud Platform/GCP).
* Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine tasks.
* Experience with configuration tools and management (e.g., Terraform and/or Puppet)

title: System Administrator / Dev Ops
description:
**Description:**

The primary duties and job focus of this position will be to design, implement, and maintain all server systems and associated hardware and software and to manage these systems to ensure a reliable, secure and cost effective Information Technology infrastructure and operation. The Systems Administrator/Dev Ops will work with application developers to ensure proper design and functionality of servers and applications as well as automate processes using scripts, custom software, and web pages.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Information
* 3+ years of hands on experience and strong background in Linux systems administration, preferably with RedHat Enterprise, CentOS, and Ubuntu in addition to Microsoft Windows Server environments. Experience must include building and deploying servers, installing, maintaining, and patching Linux and Windows operating systems, and supporting production applications in a 24x7
* Strong working knowledge of complex web hosting configuration components, including firewalls, load balancers, web, and database servers
* Experience in a programming language and aptitude to learn new technologies as needed. C# experience preferred.
* Proficiency with and understanding of virtualization on an enterprise level, preferably using VMware ESX in addition to proficiency with Cloud server environment.
* Scripting and automation skills are an integral part of our environment. The ability to maintain, enhance and create tools to help in these areas is required.

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversees the day-to-day operation of servers including hardware/software support, diagnostics, and special projects.
* Ensures 24/7 High Availability on all systems and applications.
* Collaborates with Software Engineers and provides technical and procedural direction regarding server design, database design and selection and other areas as needed and requested to ensure proper functionality of software applications and programs.
* Builds and maintains the servers and associated hardware and software required for development work, internal testing, customer testing and production environments.
* Documents, maintains, and enhances existing servers and associated hardware and software including, but not limited to: Local servers (physical and virtual) and remote servers and Applications.
* Analyzes and troubleshoots the server logs and tracks the nature and resolution of problems; monitors usage to ensure security of data and access privileges.


Bring your talent and drive to DMP! www.dmp.com/careers

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator
description:
**Who We Are**

LeMans Corporation, the leading global distributor of motorcycle, snowmobile, ATV/UTV and personal watercraft parts and accessories headquartered in Janesville, Wisconsin has an immediate opening for a Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator.

LeMans Corporation promotes racing through its campaign WE SUPPORT THE SPORT®, helping to drive consumers to dealerships, while entertaining its dealers through hospitalities at the events it sponsors. LeMans Corporation d/b/a Parts Unlimited and Drag Specialties sells to over 20,000 dealerships worldwide. We continue to expand our service territory with our sister companies, Parts Canada, and Parts Europe.

**Overview**

The Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator assists the Senior System Administrator with monitoring D365 environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds. This position performs D365 custom code deployments and other day to day system maintenance and administration of D365 as directed.

**Essential Functions**

* Performs D365 custom code deployments
* Assists Senior System Administrator with deployment of Microsoft scheduled releases
* Monitors & debugs Logic Apps to ensure integrations are functioning as expected
* Implements D365 security configurations to stay in line with Microsoft’s best practices to ensure highly available and secure environments
* Monitors the D365 environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds
* Monitors and collaborates on issues related to the D365 system
* Available during work hours through company’s communication channels: Outlook, Slack, Microsoft Teams
* Maintains strict confidentiality
* Performs other tasks and/or duties as assigned

**Non-Essential Functions**

* Performs Azure changes in conjunction with the Network support team that are impactful to D365
* Implements Azure security configurations to stay in line with Microsoft’s best practices to ensure highly available and secure environments
* Monitors the Azure environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds

**Required Qualifications and Education**

* Associates Degree required with a DevOps/Cloud computing focus preferred
* **1 or more of the following:**
* Microsoft Certificates: D365 Fundamentals (ERP), F&O Apps Dev Associate, or Finance Functional Consultant Associate
* Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) Azure
* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 systems/functional capabilities ​
* 1+ years of hands-on operational experience supporting Dynamics AX or D365 F&O ERP
* 2+ years of experience in building, monitoring, and maintaining Azure cloud environments
* Good working knowledge of MS tools such as Azure DevOps, Lifecycle Services, and Visual Studio

**Physical Demands**

Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 7+ hours
* Must be mobile within an office space to access office equipment
* Must be able to communicate verbally and written
* Must be able to read from a screen

**Disclaimer**

Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

LeMans Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. LeMans Corporation will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.

*This company participates in E-Verify*

**Notice to California Employees and Prospective Employees**  
https://downloads.lemansnet.com/docs/LeMans\\_CA\\_employee\\_privacy\\_policy.pdf

**Benefits Offered:**

* Paid Sick Time
* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* 401(k)
* Work from home
* Life Insurance
* AD&D Insurance
* Disability
* Employee Assistance Program
* Flexible Spending Account
* Referral Program
* Employee Discount

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $71,000.00 - $88,000.00 per year

Experience level:

* 1 year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Systems Administrator
description:
**Summary**  

 Idera, Inc. brands deliver best-in-class B2B software tools for testing, security, data management and application development. Idera is seeking an experienced **IT Systems Administrator** to be responsible for the implementation and operational support of all aspects of Idera’s physical and virtualized infrastructure. This infrastructure supports servers, desktops, terminal servers, networks, application virtualization and storage. A successful candidate will possess a solid understanding of virtualization products, various cloud platforms and networking fundamentals to be able to troubleshoot and resolve software, hardware, network configuration and operational problems across the IT infrastructure. Knowledge of multiple vendor technologies and platforms, including VMware, Microsoft, IBM, AWS, GCP, Unix, iOS and Cisco, is required.  

  

**Primary Responsibilities:*** Build, install, configure and maintain VMware products, including ESXi, across cloud platforms including AWS, GCP and Azure
* Provide advanced troubleshooting and problem resolution of the entire IT infrastructure
* Research the root cause of problems and collaborate across functions to provide solutions
* Develop, automate and implement IT operations best practices
* Perform Capacity Management functions
* Effectively collaborate with Server, Storage, Network, Data Center, Facilities, Audit, Compliance, PMO, and DevOps teams
* Proactively implement advanced maintenance and resolve issues related to performance cloud environments
* Troubleshoot common network protocols across various cloud platforms
* Configure and maintain storage infrastructure, ensuring optimal availability, performance and best practices
* Manage problem and service tickets to ensure timely resolution and meet internal service level agreements
* Follow established enterprise change management procedures
* Participate in Business Continuation and Disaster Recovery infrastructure planning, building, and testing
* Must have the ability to understand and relate to new products, technology, strategy
* Must be able to provide project management that includes planning, documentation, meetings, conference calls and reporting.
* Ability to conduct training sessions to share knowledge with peers and other support teams is necessary

title: Systems Administrator, Junior
description:
Systems Administrator, Junior**The Opportunity:**


Your combination of people skills and system administrator expertise makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. What if you could use those skills to improve the technology supporting our team, clients, and mission? We’re looking for a system administrator who is fluent in Windows Server Administration, basic networking knowledge, and exhibits strong communication skills to help us further enhance our remote development lab capabilities.


As a system administrator on our team, you’ll facilitate account setup and management, system configuration management, and security best-practice implementation. You’ll learn how to help clients overcome challenges through monitoring and performance management. You’ll analyze problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission-critical network.


You’ll combine your technical knowledge and communication skills to turn metrics into information and articulate their meaning. This is an opportunity to gain experience with VMWare Horizon and enhance Scripting and Automation to foster the automation of routine tasks and to help streamline processes. We focus on growing as a team, so we’ll share techniques, work through challenges, and develop new methodologies together. Work with us and resolve daily challenges as we improve the remote lab capabilities.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

**You Have:**

* Experience in Windows Server Administration, configuring and managing Windows Server operating systems
* Experience with Active Directory, including setting up and managing domain controllers
* Experience with security concepts and best practices, including user permissions, access controls, and encryption
* Knowledge of setting up and managing file shares on Windows servers
* Knowledge of Group Policy management for configuring and controlling user and computer settings
* Knowledge of backup strategies and recovery procedures for both Windows servers and virtual machines
* Knowledge of tools and techniques for monitoring system performance and making necessary optimizations
* Ability to deploy, configure, and manage virtual machines using VMware vSphere
* Ability to obtain a security clearance
* HS diploma or GED

**Nice If You Have:**

* Experience with VMware Horizon for virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) setup and management
* Experience with Scripting and Automation tools, including PowerShell, to automate routine tasks and streamline processes
* Ability to diagnose and resolve issues related to Windows servers and VMware infrastructure
* Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills for collaborating with team members, documenting processes, and providing support
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physical Science

**Clearance:**

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

**Create Your Career:**

**Grow With Us**


Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

**A Place Where You Belong**


Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

**Support Your Well-Being**


Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

**Your Candidate Journey**


At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

**Compensation**


At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.


Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $49,900.00 to $102,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.**Work Model**  

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

* If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
* If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

**EEO Commitment**


We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Enrollment Systems Administrator
description:
**Enrollment Systems Administrator**
**Location:** Remote
**Type:** Staff, Full-time
**Salary range starts at:** $42,000
**Diversity Statement:**
Columbia College is committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all regardless of race, color, national origin, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, or disability. The college maintains a safe place for open discourse; supports activities that promote diversity and inclusion; and overall, fosters a sense of community that welcomes everyone.
**Job Summary:**The Enrollment Systems Administrator is a multifaceted role encompassing business and systems analysis, support for various processes and technologies with expertise in Columbia College’s CRM, Salesforce. The position will also develop expertise in behind-the-scene support for enrollment systems through Colleague, OnBase, MyPortal, Stellic, and other College systems that impact student experience. They will oversee projects of varying size and complexity utilizing analytical skills along with technical aptitude and a keen attention to detail. The Enrollment System Administrator will be responsible for ensuring the data in the CRM system is clean and usable and is accurately transferring to and from various databases. The position supports maintenance and development within Salesforce and related systems, including product upgrades, campus initiatives, adding communications to the system, building filters and reports, and implementing and leveraging additional features.
**Essential Functions:**
* Perform job duties in accordance with Columbia College’s vision, mission, and values, and contributes to the development of the Enrollment Systems.
* Build and maintain relationships with departments across the College; partnering with them to help identify, assess, and prioritize their needs as it relates to using the CRM or other systems that are supported through Enrollment Systems.
* Collaborate with Enrollment Systems staff and cross-functional stakeholders to define and analyze current state processes, pain points, and opportunities for improvement – using this discovery to help define goals, objectives, and the overall scope of projects.
* Identify and evaluate solution alternatives, define process flows, develop solution business requirements, develop solution technical requirements and integration specifications, and prepare business cases – taking into consideration user experience, compliance, return on investment, systems capabilities, systems constraints, and other business drivers. Take initiative in researching creative solutions to the identified system issues and limitations.
* Develop project plans/schedules (independently or in partnership with the rest of the Enrollment Systems team), monitor team progress, communicate updates, and take corrective actions as needed.
* Use analytics, customer feedback, and performance of routinely scheduled tasks to monitor the effectiveness of processes and solutions and to identify opportunities for continuous improvement. When applicable, serve as a liaison with technical and vendor teams for issue resolution.
* Provide analytical and technical support for various departmental needs from the CRM. The role must understand integration with other enterprise systems and reporting best practices within the CRM.
* Understand various system options at Columbia College and help develop solutions that best utilize the systems for efficiency and student experience.
* Continually develop soft and technical skills through personal initiative and various training opportunities. Maintain a working knowledge of industry trends, best practices, and product roadmaps to help identify risks and opportunities that should be considered.
* Provide comprehensive testing prior to installation of Ellucian Colleague patches and updates.
* Maintain the Colleague registration and evaluation modules, including but not limited to degree audit, registration rules and prerequisites.
* Through maintenance of enrollment systems, help facilitate a more comprehensive approach to collaboration between database silos, fostering a more seamless integration between recruitment and marketing systems with current student systems.
* Practice superior customer service through Enrollment Systems various customer support avenues. This includes incoming phone calls, support requests created via department email address, and responding to questions on a Teams channel.
* Feel comfortable working with Microsoft applications such as Excel, Outlook, and Teams to facilitate seamless integration and communication within the organization.
* Perform job duties in accordance with Columbia College’s vision, mission, and values, and contributes to the development of the Enrollment Systems.
* Fulfill additional responsibilities as assigned.
* Display respect and civility to all constituencies in all communications
* Attend work timely and on a regular basis during the established hours of operation; work additional hours as business necessitates.

*This job description is not meant to be all-inclusive of every duty and responsibility required by the employee in the position.*
**Position reports to:** **Director of the Enrollment Systems**
**Required Core Competencies and Professional Experience:*** Ability to fluently read, write, and understand the English language.
* Proficiency with the following, but not limited to: active listening; speaking; writing; critical thinking; judgment and decision making; monitoring; reading comprehension; time management; coordination; and management of personnel resources.
* Proficiency for using a variety of computer and technology-related software and equipment, including Microsoft Office products and database systems.
* Proficiency in using web-based technologies, including database systems.
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment, with or without direct supervision.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, customer service, and organizational skills.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience in higher education
* Two or more years of experience with CRM experience


**Required Level of Education:** Bachelors **In:**
