title: IT Support Specialist
description:
Description:

Tavistock Development is currently seeking an IT Support Specialist.


Tavistock Development is a diversified real estate firm specializing in planning, design, finance, construction and development.


Tavistock hires people who:

* Act with integrity
* Are proactive and value results
* Are innovative
* Uphold our reputation and brand
* Play, as a team
* Embrace a dynamic environment
* Care for each other


If you identify with these characteristics, want to work with a growing company and are interested in an IT Support Specialist position, please apply today. We offer great benefits, competitive salaries, an inspiring work environment and the latest employment practices.


Title: IT Support Specialist


FLSA Status: Non-Exempt


Type: Full-time


Supervisor: Senior IT Operations & Software Systems Manager

**General Summary:**


As an IT Systems Administration support specialist, this role is responsible for operating the TDC IT of our Microsoft, Cisco, Dell, Apple, VMWare, and Cisco-based environment. The successful candidate will provide timely and professional support to internal & external users while contributing to the upgrade, maintenance, and implementation of IT infrastructure and network solutions. Candidate should be well-versed in help desk procedures, Windows / MAC Desktop Operating Systems, Active Directory, Cybersecurity, A/V, and network technologies. This position will be responsible for documenting all IT support activities and working closely and efficiently with various internal employees and external vendors. Excellent interpersonal, customer experience focus, and communication skills are a must.

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Provide technical support to staff utilizing Windows 11 / MacOS / O365 based workstations.
* Capable of independently handle helpdesk requests and work on multiple tickets/issues at a given time.
* Supports the company’s offsite locations (workstation, application, network support)
* Build, replace, and upgrade laptop hardware (Dell, Microsoft, Apple-based hardware)
* Moving desktops/monitors and setup per user requirements (setup new workstations)
* Manage AD including user/group rights and permissions
* Setup mobile devices and update policies when needed via MDM
* Track case tickets within a helpdesk management system to document resolutions for future reference
* Participate in after-hours support rotation
* Create documentation for the utilization of new equipment/services
* Manage company’s Antivirus system; maintain definitions and remove viruses and malware
* Support A/V meeting rooms operations
* Provides first-tier support for the TDC systems environment – MRI, Smartsheet, Adobe Suite, O365, AWS, VMware
* Responsible for executing Business Continuity duties – server and desktop backups, Mi-Fi, hurricane preparedness execution
* Support printing services at the TDC office and remote locations.
* Work from Home remote support capabilities using Splashtop
* Execute on-boarding and off-boarding process
* All other duties as assigned


Requirements:
**Essential Qualifications:**

* Two years experience in a help desk position
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Customer service focused individual with prior experience in a helpdesk role with excellent verbal and written communication skills; comfortable interacting with end-users
* Basic networking proficiency: LAN, WAN, VLANS, TCP/IP, Wireless VOIP
* Knowledge of Microsoft365 hosted services
* Ability to analyze, implement and support new technologies and systems
* Some experience with enterprise backup and restore tools and techniques

**Essential Physical Requirements:**

* Must be physically able to do assigned work as outlined above. Must be physically able to sit and use the computer as required.
* Must be able to communicate in English effectively with other individuals.


This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” employment relationship. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this position. The employee will be required to follow any other reasonable instructions and to perform any other reasonable duties requested by the supervisor.

title: Workfront System Administrator
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**



Craft Worldwide, part of the IPG group, is a globally connected creative production business of over 1,300 creative makers. The IPG/Craft Worldwide Technology Team is seeking to add a Workfront System Administrator to its team as it embarks upon deploying Workfront to its workforce. This is a hands-on configuration and administration role, responsible for utilizing, enabling, and optimizing Craft’s Global Workfront instance. The role includes system governance, implementing functionality enhancements, maintaining system stability, and supporting users with reporting.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


**Workfront System Administration and Configuration Management:**

* Plays a hands-on role in the implementation of system functionality modules or new/existing group rollouts.
* Assists with the evaluation of user feedback for system changes and enhancements, and impacts assessment of any change before proceeding.
* Partners with other team members to manage troubleshooting and recommend solutions to system or user issues.
* Conducts regular audits on system utilization and data to increase system quality.


**Workfront Governance:**

* Helping drive the use and adoption of Workfront across the business.
* Supports the organization on system best practices and utilization alterations to best serve their working group while staying compliant with global solutions.
* Be seen as an expert Workfront User, understanding all areas of functionality and how they should be used by different personas and user types.
* Partners with our internal teams on any architecture, integration, or support needs for Workfront.


**Workfront Reporting & Resource Management:**

* Creating visibility and understanding of the work and resource utilization.
* Establishes metrics and builds reports and dashboards to aid in user workflow, portfolio/program/projects, channel project types and resource management.
* Performs statistical analysis on gathered data, running queries and makes recommendations.


**Workfront System Training:**


* As part of a team, provides training and information to the organization.
* Creates training materials – including but not limited to: training presentations, QRGs (Quick Reference Guides), Job Aids and training videos.
* Assisting with new employee onboarding to ensure familiarity with the Workfront system and understanding of role-specific responsibilities within the system


**EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT:**


* At least 2 years of related professional experience in Workfront system administration.
* 5+ years of experience in a professional, client-focused environment
* Proven experience in managing Workfront administration within a large corporation.
* Ability to explain complex technical material clearly to users with varying levels of proficiency.
* Due to the geographic disbursement of the team, must be able to prioritize and manage own workload in a fast-paced environment.
* General understanding of the marketing and creative workflow processes.
* Experience in system implementations and enhancements.
* Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Intuitive problem solver with the ability to anticipate and action plan.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presenting to various levels within an organization.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.


**BENEFITS OF JOINING IPG:**



One of our primary goals is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our compensation plan includes the following benefits, in addition to many others:


* Healthcare Options
	+ Medical
	+ Dental
	+ Vision
	+ Prescription
* Dependent and Health Care Flexible Spending Accounts
* 401(k) savings plan with company match
* Flexible based Paid Time Off
* Employee Assistance Program
* Legal Assistance Plan
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Exclusive discounts on cell phones, gyms, and everyday purchases


IPG is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity inclusion and equity at our company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, disability, genetic information or veteran status or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Systems Administrator (Remote Eligible)
description:

title: Linux Administrator
description:
**About Innovatus Technologies:**


Innovatus Technologies is a dynamic and innovative technology solutions provider to the government and DoD committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients. As a leading player in the industry, we are seeking a skilled and experienced Linux Administrator to join our talented team. If you are passionate about Linux systems, scripting, and ensuring robust IT infrastructure, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

**Position Overview:**


We are looking for a Remote Linux Administrator with a Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or an equivalent technical field from an accredited college or university. The ideal candidate will have at least six years of hands-on experience in administering Linux operating systems, with a particular focus on Red Hat Enterprise Linux. The successful candidate will also possess expertise in scripting languages such as BASH and Perl, and be well-versed in DHCP, DNS, and maintaining Department of Defense (DoD) Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) compliance.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Linux System Administration:**


	+ Administer and maintain Linux servers, with a primary focus on Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
	+ Install, configure, and optimize Linux systems for performance and reliability.
	+ Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues promptly.
* **Scripting:**


	+ Develop, write, and maintain BASH and Perl shell scripts to automate routine tasks and enhance system efficiency.
	+ Implement scripting solutions to streamline deployment processes and ensure system stability.
* **Networking:**


	+ Configure and manage DHCP and DNS services on Linux servers.
	+ Troubleshoot network-related issues and collaborate with network administrators to optimize performance.
* **DoD STIG Compliance:**


	+ Ensure that Linux systems adhere to Department of Defense Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) standards.
	+ Conduct regular security audits and implement necessary measures to address vulnerabilities.
* **Collaboration and Documentation:**


	+ Work closely with cross-functional teams to support various IT projects and initiatives.
	+ Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to system configurations, processes, and procedures.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
* Minimum of six years of experience in Linux system administration.
* Strong proficiency in Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
* Expertise in scripting languages, specifically BASH and Perl.
* Experience with DHCP and DNS configuration.
* Familiarity with DoD STIG Compliance requirements.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

title: Systems Administrator (DGI)
description:
The System Administrator is a crucial role in ensuring that our software and infrastructure remain secure, stable, and reliable. They are responsible for monitoring and maintaining both Windows and Linux servers, working closely within the IT Department to ensure that the system is always available and performing at its best. Additionally, they troubleshoot any issues that arise to ensure that the system remains functioning smoothly.


**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Monitors and troubleshoots software and infrastructure issues, such as network connectivity, server availability, performance, backup failures, etc.
* Ensure Azure environment security by monitoring and improving current and future systems.
* Planning, configuring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all network hardware, software, and communication links.
* Performing regular maintenance and updates on Windows and Linux servers, such as installing patches, configuring settings, managing users and permissions, etc.
* Coordinating with other IT staff and vendors to ensure the smooth operation of software and infrastructure systems, such as resolving conflicts, implementing changes, testing functionality, etc.
* Documenting and reporting on software and infrastructure activities, such as creating logs, generating reports, providing feedback, etc.
* Developing and implementing best practices and policies for software and infrastructure management, such as creating standards, procedures, guidelines, etc.
* Other duties as assigned.
* Reports to the VP of Information Technology
* Target Compensation range is $70k-$80k

  


**SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:**


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field or similar work experience required.
* 3 to 5 years of proven experience as a System Administrator or similar role highly preferred.
* Experience with databases, servers, networks (LAN, WAN) and patch management
* Background with Microsoft Office Suite (including SharePoint, Teams) and Exchange Administration
* Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
* Ability to create and maintain scripts.
* Familiarity with various operating systems (including Windows) and platforms.
* Passionate, Adaptable, Customer Focused and Teamwork oriented.
* Strong sense of urgency and accountability
* Strong experience working with Azure Cloud platform
* Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
* Excellent communication skills
* Professional certification (e.g. Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA)) is a plus

  


**EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY INCLUDES:**


* Competitive benefits, including: medical, dental, vision, life, STD & LTD insurance options, FSA, 401(k) and Profit Sharing
* Career growth

  



DGI Supply is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates are subject to background checks and a post-offer drug screen.

  



#LI-REMOTE

#### **Education**


Preferred* Bachelors or better

#### **Skills**


Preferred* Teamwork
* Customer Focus
* Passion
* Adaptable

#### **Behaviors**


Preferred* Thought Provoking: Capable of making others think deeply on a subject
* Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
* Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking
* Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject
* Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
* Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
* Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

#### **Motivations**


Preferred* Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
* Peer Recognition: Inspired to perform well by the praise of coworkers
* Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility
* Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks
* Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Systems Administrator**


**Ft. Meade, MD (Remote)**

  


**SUMMARY:**


Founded in 2001, Indigo IT is an award winning information technology consulting and services company. We are a trusted services provider to government agencies seeking innovative Cloud, Cybersecurity, Knowledge Management, and Enterprise solutions. We know our defense, federal, and civilian customers have critical IT infrastructures that must remain reliable, available, and maximized. Indigo IT is mission focused and committed to maintaining a sense of urgency in anticipating and supporting our customers’ technology goals and objectives. Our unique ability to think beyond today allows our clients to stay ahead of their IT challenges. Recognized on the Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest growing companies in 2020 & 2021, and named as one of the 2022 Best Places to Work in Virginia, we are always looking to hire top talent in the field - come join us today!

  


Embark on a dynamic career as a Systems Administrator, contributing to the forefront of Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)'s groundbreaking initiatives. Join the team dedicated to the modernization of the Joint Force Headquarters - Department of Defense Information Network (JFHQ DoDIN) security model through the adoption of Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA). As a Systems Administrator, your role will be instrumental in ensuring the robustness, reliability, and security of mission-critical systems within the framework of ZTA principles.

  


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Administer and maintain the health of systems within the JFHQ DoDIN, implementing ZTA principles for enhanced security.
* Perform routine system monitoring, ensuring optimal performance, and promptly addressing any anomalies or issues.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement ZTA reference architectures, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems.
* Conduct regular systems updates, patches, and backups to enhance system security and stability.
* Respond to system-related incidents, troubleshoot technical issues, and provide timely resolution to minimize downtime.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of ZTA strategies, aligning system administration activities with cybersecurity best practices.

  




**SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:**


* Proficient knowledge of system administration, including operating systems, networking, and cybersecurity principles.


* Familiarity with ZTA principles and their practical implementation in a defense environment.


* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues efficiently.


* Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


* Detail-oriented approach to ensure the reliability and security of mission-critical systems.

  


**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & CERTIFICATIONS:**


* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Relevant certifications are advantageous.
* Proven experience as a Systems Administrator, preferably in a defense or security-focused environment.
* Familiarity with cybersecurity best practices, ZTA, and related technologies.
* Security certifications such as CompTIA Security+, Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), or equivalent, are desirable.


Indigo IT is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. This employer uses E-Verify.

title: Finance Systems Administrator - Remote
description:
**About Comply365**
-------------------


Comply365 is a leading global provider of SaaS solutions for enterprise customers in highly regulated industries like aviation and rail. Our applications help mobile workforces access, author, and effectively use critical information. We save time and money, increasing safety and operational efficiency for our customers.


Our culture truly sets us apart at Comply365. In addition to our unwavering dedication to our customers and products that we offer, we are, first and foremost, a diverse team of driven, energetic, and passionate individuals who work together to make a direct impact on the future of our company. We have built, and continue to build a world-class, dynamic, and people-first culture. We believe in celebrating one another's achievements, open communication, and transparent leadership.


In January 2024, Comply365 and Vistair announced their merger and strategic growth investment from Insight Partners and Liberty Hall Capital Partners. The combination of Comply365 and Vistair creates a leading global provider of compliance, safety and data intelligence technologies serving the aviation, defense and rail industries with over 120 customers located in more than 30 countries on 6 continents.

**About The Position**
----------------------


We are seeking a highly motivated Finance Systems Administrator to join our team to implement and maintain our financial systems and ensure the accuracy, efficiency, and compliance of our data and reporting. You will collaborate with accounting and finance and wider teams to ensure system alignment with business needs, to provide financial insights and to support strategic decision-making.


In this newly created opportunity, you will get to work in a fast-growing private equity-backed global SaaS tech company with continuously evolving needs.

### **Essential Duties And Responsibilities:**


Systems Management:

* Implement, maintain, and optimize financial systems and processes, including ERP and financial data driven by the CRM
* Analyze system use and performance and identify areas for improvement.
* Design and implement system upgrades and enhancements.
* Design and manage system security and access controls.
* Develop and document system procedures and documentation.


Technical Collaboration:

* Provide technical support to accounting, finance and other staff on system-related issues
* Collaborate with IT departments on system integration projects
* Stay up to date on the latest financial systems and technologies in order to drive continual improvement


Financial Alignment:

* Partner with accounting and finance teams to understand business needs and translate them into system requirements
* Configure systems to ensure accurate and efficient financial data flow.
* Design, continuously improve and enforce a data model which supports the strategic objectives of the business
* Generate reports and provide data-driven insights to support financial decision-making.

### **Required Qualifications and Skills:**

* CPA certification is desired
* 3+ years of experience in a systems accountant or similar role
* Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
* Proven experience in using financial accounting software, such as Netsuite
* Experience with the wider business software ecosystem, such as Salesforce
* A can-do attitude with analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a global team
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite

**Why join Comply365?**
-----------------------


You're not just accepting a new job when you join our team. You're making a career move. Here's how we'll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:

* Remote-first, flexible work environment
* Unlimited PTO
* Paid Holidays
* Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, HSA, and FSA)
* Paid leave benefits
* 401(k) plan with company match
* Ample learning and development opportunities
* Employee referral bonus
* Semi-annual on-site meetings
* Fun, positive, collaborative environment!


Comply365 is a global company, and our success draws upon our employees' diverse viewpoints, skills, and experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Business Systems Administrator
description:
Pie's mission is to empower small businesses to thrive by making commercial insurance affordable and as easy as pie. We leverage technology to transform how small businesses buy and experience commercial insurance.

Like our small business customers, we are a diverse team of builders, dreamers, and entrepreneurs who are driven by core values and operating principles that guide every decision we make.

The Business System Administrator will be part of an agile business systems team accountable for supporting and maintaining functionality within the Pie Insurance technology ecosystem. This individual will work cross-functionally with members of both technical and business staff to help provide application support, build out Pie's application stack along our Customer Journey (SFDC, Policy System, Claims System, Telephony, etc.) according to best practices, and ensure successful deployments. This role is critical for achieving strategic company-level objectives, while collaborating cross-functionally to ensure a succinct operational experience for their stakeholders.


### **How You'll Do It**


* Design
+ Support platform security protocols including roles, profiles, sharing rules and permission sets, as well as license assignment
+ Creates and/or maintains key product documentation (e.g., customer journey map, technical specs, process mapping, etc.).
+ Monitor application support trends and identify potential problems
+ Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on platforms within the Customer Journey space and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes
+ Contribute to Pie's system documentation repository

* Execute
+ Construct solutions to challenging business problems using standard platform functionality (reports and dashboards, workflow automation via declarative & programmatic functionality)
+ "Work on completing the regular internal system audits and database maintenance
+ Provide user technical support by helping troubleshoot issues and answer questions about using Pie's technology
+ Ability to document and escalate unresolved issues

* Collaborate
+ Ability to navigate ambiguity, resolve issues with users, and work autonomously to solve problems
+ Train, educate, and coach business lines to enhance their knowledge and competencies to empower them and make them self-sufficient in owning and managing their data.
+ Assist in data analysis, data prep and research as needed by the user stories

### **The Right Stuff**



* 2-5 years of experience working with business systems, ideally in a similar role.
* Experience with Call center software like Five9, Genesys, RingCentral, etc is preferred
* Experience supporting Claims Management systems or other Insurance industry related software is preferred
* Basic knowledge of computer hardware and software, including operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux), networks, and databases.|
* Strong understanding of Salesforce best practices and functionality
* Understanding of system security, data backup and recovery procedures.
* Self-motivated, adaptable, learning agile, and a problem solver. Ability to work on diverse, cross-cultural teams.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.
* Customer service orientation and ability to effectively handle user issues.
* Experience working as part of a Scrum team


#LI-MS1


**Base Compensation Range**


$80,000—$110,000 USD### **Compensation & Benefits**


* Competitive cash compensation

title: System Administrator
description:
```Duties```  
- Install, configure, and maintain systems hardware and software  
- Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues  
- Implement security measures to protect systems and data  
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement new systems  
- Manage user accounts and permissions  
- Conduct regular system backups and ensure data integrity  
- Provide technical support to end-users  
- Document system configurations and procedures

```Requirements```  
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field  
- Proven experience as a Systems Administrator or similar role  
- Strong knowledge of Azure cloud services and Microservices architecture  
- Proficiency in DNS, DHCP, and load balancing technologies  
- Experience with PL/SQL and NoSQL databases  
- Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices  
- Knowledge of Jenkins for continuous integration and deployment  
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Note: The above list of skills is not exhaustive. We are looking for candidates who are adaptable, eager to learn, and can quickly pick up new technologies.

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for technology and a desire to work in a collaborative environment, we would love to hear from you. Please apply with your updated resume.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00 - $40.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Applications Systems Administrator
description:
Newcore Technology Group provides flexible, scalable Information Technology staffing and consulting solutions that help clients and employees transform and evolve while delivering true business value.

  




We are assisting our client, a printing and digital media organization, in their search for a Systems Administrator. This is a direct hire, full-time, 100% remote position with some travel required.

  


**JOB TITLE:** Application Systems Administrator

  


**POSITION SUMMARY**



The Application Systems Administrator is a subject matter expert for designated programs and responsible for provisioning, supporting and/or coordinating installation & configuration, operation, maintenance and updating of the software, workflows and related infrastructure.


This individual participates in technical research and business analysis to enable continuing innovation and is responsible for ensuring the systems and related procedures adhere to organizational values while enabling staff, volunteers, and partners.

  



This role is often engaged in both project delivery as well as operational support. The ideal applicant will have print MIS/ERP application admin experience with operational expertise. This role may also participate in research and technical analysis for new needs related to the same systems that are assigned for support/oversight.

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  



Team Engagement:


* Provide system leadership, technical support, user support, technical orientation, and technical education activities to project teams and staff in areas of assigned oversight.
* Partnering with plants to gather requirements to formulate business specifications and translating those into application functionality.
* Documenting workflows and results of business analysis and obtaining sign-off on requirements.
* Manage Support desk tickets or ongoing support of application. Provide internal training of feature / enhancement or workflows from end to end for all relevant products to end users and help desk staff.
* Creation of training and process workflow documentation.
* Conduct training for system use and process workflows.
* Troubleshooting and issue resolution/remediation
* Work closely with software vendor’s support team and be able to document replication steps for issues or specifications for software changes.
* Contribute to and maintain system standards.
* Research, develop, and implement innovative and where possible automated approaches for system or users’ tasks.
* Identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale.


Training and Implementations


* Travel to plant locations as needed for system implementations. This involves training end users and management in how to use the system. Also creating workflows for the plants to standardize certain aspects of the system for Enterprise use and reporting.
* Conduct both remote and on-site training sessions for users to learn the systems.
* Work with implementation team to set up new plants in the system and all that goes with implementing a new system.

  



Regular Monitoring and Maintenance


* Use monitoring tools and log analysis to detect issues and proactively engage technical support if needed.
* Coordinate maintenance activities for vendor updates, patches, and hotfixes for the software, in accordance with company’s patch management policy.
* Facilitate testing and approval for system updates and patches to ensure that they are working correctly.
* Security and Access Control
* Ensure that security measures are in place and regularly updated to protect against unauthorized access and data breaches.
* Validate application access is in line with enterprise access control policies and procedures to restrict access to sensitive data and applications.
* Regularly perform security audits to identify vulnerabilities and address security issues.


Documentation and Reporting


* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of training documentation and workflow documentation.
* Maintain Enterprise SharePoint documentation site with latest versions of documentation and any other relevant information.
* Provide regular status reports as needed by management.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS**



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. In keeping with company’s philosophy that each individual should be encouraged to reach his or her full potential, and in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), reasonable accommodations or modifications will be made for qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. Hours may vary depending on departmental staffing needs.


* Bachelor’s degree in information technology or equivalent work experience


Have experience of at least one ERP package, either as an admin or as a power end user


* 3+ years’ experience in an Applications System Administration role, or similar role
* Excellent Communication skills
* Excellent Problem-solving skills.
* Experience with print MIS/ERP strongly preferred

Experience with report writing (Crystal, SQL) a plus.  
* 

  

**FLSA STATUS:** Exempt  



  

**TRAVEL:** Travel to plant locations may be required during implementation. Estimated travel is 30%.


**DISCLAIMER**



The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of employees.

  



Newcore Technology Group does not discriminate in employment opportunities, terms and conditions of employment, or practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, gender, religious or political beliefs, national origin or heritage, disability, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Our team is looking for a Systems Administrator to support the design, development, and deployment of a smart manufacturing environment that will enable the efficient production of munitions and energetics. The right candidate will analyze the existing hardware and software assets. The Systems Administrator will guide the introduction of new hardware and software assets and mitigate any adverse outcomes to existing manufacturing operations. The Systems Administrator will monitor system health and provide notifications for anticipated safety and production concerns. The right candidate will collaborate with cloud, UI/UX, 5G, sensor, and cyber teams to deploy an end-to-end sensor-to-cloud manufacturing environment.
  
  

Evans & Chambers partners with the US national defense community to create fully integrated, resilient, and innovative digital solutions that enable them to make smart decisions in real-time. We work with our customers on everything from conquering their data to improving and safeguarding IT infrastructure. Our ultimate goal? To enhance our nation's ability to identify, address, and act – no matter what challenges arise.
  
  

**Location:** Remote (with routine travel to the Washington DC Metro Area)
  
  

**Clearance:** US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance
  
  

**You will be expected to:**  

* Identify, assess, and document existing customer hardware and software assets and its configuration
* Assess, analyze, and document server resiliency measures, such as backup servers, power, and potential implementation of Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) systems.
* Assess, analyze, and document network specifications to on-site server locations. This includes bandwidth, network connection type (ethernet, fiber, Wi-Fi), and existing ingress and egress usage on the network.
* Assess, analyze, and document customer security and compliance processes for release of application updates onto the on-site servers, end-user devices, and offline storage devices
* Review and analyze existing plant machinery and associated device interfaces
* Assess and document customer requirements surrounding safety, security, productivity, and quality of assets.
* Identify and configure end-user devices and servers for inter-departmental communication, reporting, and tracking


**Preferred:**  

* Have experience working in a DoD manufacturing environment
* Have experience working within an energetics or ordnance environment
* Have experience with AWS cloud technologies and monitoring tools
* Have experience with 4G and 5G data transport networks


**Required:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent military experience
* 5+ years of experience in Systems Administration
* Ability to document designs and communicate with customers


All employment opportunities are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status or any other basis protected by law.

title: IT Systems Administrator (Remote)
description:
CoinTracker makes cryptocurrency portfolio tracking and tax compliance simple. Beyond cryptocurrency, we are building a general automated financial assistant for all financial assets. Our mission is to increase the financial freedom and prosperity of the world.


Some things we’re proud of:


Building foundational tools in the cryptocurrency space


$50B+ in cryptocurrency is tracked on CoinTracker – over 5% of the entire crypto market


1M tax forms filed


Partnered with Coinbase, Uniswap, OpenSea, eToro, H&R Block and other industry leaders


Venture-backed by Accel, General Catalyst, Y Combinator, Initialized Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Kraken Ventures, Intuit Ventures, 776 Ventures, Balaji Srinivasan, Claire Hughes Johnson, Gokul Rajaram, Ryan Shea, Serena Williams, Zach Perret, and others


Founders: Jon previously built TextNow (200M downloads), Chandan was previously a product manager at Google & Google[x]


Learn more about our mission, culture, and hiring process.

**Your opportunity**
--------------------


As the founding member of CoinTracker's IT systems administration team, you will facilitate strong productivity and security with best-in-class internal hardware, software, and processes. You will also play a critical role in defining CoinTracker’s culture.

**1-year outcomes**
-------------------

* Technical ownership of HRIS (Rippling)
* Deep collaboration and process alignment with people team, including supporting roadmap for pod-people quarterly goals
* Comprehensive security best practices taught to every existing employee and new employee on their first week
* Ownership of the IT admin roadmap


	+ Security
	+ Communication
	+ Administration
	+ Employee experience
* Tech vendor relationships owned and managed in partnership with team finance including renewals and contract negotiations
* Robust internal systems help desk
* SOC (1,2) compliance maintained in partnership with infrastructure team

**You will**
------------

* Ensure that our team is rapidly and seamlessly onboarded to and off-boarded from all systems
* Work cross-functionally with our security, infrastructure engineering, finance, and people teams to make every CoinTracker successful
* Help CoinTrackers troubleshoot technical issues and support them with their hardware and software needs so that they can be highly productive
* Build, manage, and scale our hardware management system, including ensuring international delivery for all new team members before their start date
* Enforce a rigorous set of security standards across the organization
* Setup a Single-Sign-On (SSO) solution that integrates with all of our existing tooling

**Some of the skills that we are excited about**
------------------------------------------------

* 3+ years of IT system administration experience at a high-growth tech company
* Experience setting up, managing, and scaling technical operations and processes
* Strong working knowledge of Apple systems and software
* Understanding of script execution and troubleshooting (e.g. Bash, Python)
* Experience managing a successful SOC 2 audit
* Experience setting up single-sign-on (SSO)
* Strong background administrating software such as GitHub, Google Workspace, Notion, Slack, Zoom
* Genuine interest in cryptocurrency and personal finance
* Works effectively in a remote setting and able to overlap with our core hours of 9 AM to 12 PM PT

**What's it like working at CoinTracker?**
------------------------------------------


We are a fully internationally distributed, tight-knit team. We have minimal process, and the majority of our time is spent working and collaborating asynchronously through tools like Figma, Github, Linear, Notion, Rippling, Slack, Zendesk, and Zoom. We also stay aligned and bonded through weekly sprints, standups, all-hands, and socials. We aim to empower every individual on the team with full transparency, ownership, autonomy, and clear objectives. Learn more about our guiding principles.


If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you’re a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We’re looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting.

title: Network Administrator
description:
**Job Title:** Network Administrator
**Location:** US-Remote
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
This position shall perform the following (to include but not limited to) activities:
* Oversee and implement switch provisioning (configuration) and implementation across multiple sites, including coordinating cutover logistics and change management.
* Establish network monitoring for newly installed and replaced equipment.
* Support and operate Software-Defined Wide Area Networks (SD-WAN) sites
* Support and maintain network equipment and configuration (routers and routing).
* Manage the LAN/WAN routing protocol between the routers and perform port management, network capacity management (including planning and trending).
* Provision and configuring switches and routers.
* Assists with vulnerability patching and IOS upgrades.
* Utilize and implement network orchestration tools and techniques to facilitate automated and consistent configurations, management, testing, deployment, and operations of physical and virtual devices within the network.
* Manage status, errors, and inbound and outbound traffic statistics of all routing interfaces, bandwidth utilization, and errors of all inbound and outbound LAN/WAN circuits.
* Makes technical decisions on kinds of data to be gathered and methods to be used in data collection and analysis.
* Provides technical direction, guidance, and assistance to assigned projects, suggesting efficient approaches and methods for solving problems..
* Analyzes, diagnoses, and recommends solutions to complex problems.
* Escalate issues to vendor and third-party entities, as necessary and directed by the Government.
* Generates / updates network documentation in coordination with the onsite installation resources.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with associates and client personnel at all levels.
* Produce knowledge base articles and SOPs.


**Qualifications:**
**CONTRACT REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
This following are REQUIRED for this position:
* Public Trust Clearance and ITILv4 Foundation Certification by start date.
* Possesses and applies a comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments.
* Previous experience with TrustSec.
* Previous experience with vulnerability patching and IOS upgrades.
* Previous experience supporting and operating Software-Defined Wide Area Networks (SD-WAN) sites
* Design and develop solutions to complex applications problems, system administration issues, or network concerns.
* Proven ability to work independently in a full and/or partial remote environment with limited supervision and may supervise/lead others.
* Possess the ability to communicate in both oral and written forms, demonstrating an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff as well as clients.
* Possess the ability to communicate in both oral and written forms, demonstrating an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff as well as clients.
* Possesses and applies expertise on multiple complex work assignments.
* Assignments may be broad in nature, requiring originality and innovation in determining how to accomplish tasks.
* Operates with appreciable latitude in developing methodology and presenting solutions to problems.
* Contributes to deliverables and performance metrics where applicable.
* Maintain standard working hours per the DIGIT contract and to be available for meetings, and other collaborative efforts during working hours.


**CONTRACT DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
The following are DESIRED for this position:
* Proficient in configuring the following protocols: BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, and Static routes.
* Familiar with SD-WAN architectures such as Cisco (Viptela), and VMware (VeloCloud)
* Design network architecture for Software Design Access / Software Defined Networks, utilizing Cisco DNA Center.
* Cisco Certified Networking Professional (CCNP) or Cisco Certified Networking Associate (CCNA).
* Must be willing to work a variety of shifts, including holidays as scheduled.
* Shall possess the ability to communicate in both oral and written forms, demonstrating an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff as well as clients.
* Demonstrated ability to apply comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments.
* Familiarity with the following technologies: Active Directory, Windows, ServiceNow, Network Monitoring Systems (Solarwinds), Cisco Prime, LAN/WAN control protocols.
* Proficiency in the Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Chat, Meet, Docs, Slides, Sheets), Slack, and ServiceNow.
* Must be willing to work a variety of shifts, including holidays as scheduled.
* 2+ years of experience configuring the following protocols: BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, and Static routes.

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**
The following are the education and experience required for this position:
* 4-9 years of experience and Bachelor’s degree
* 4+ years of experience performing vulnerability management utilizing automation technologies such as Ansible, Python, and Cisco Prime.
* Previous experience with Software Defined Access (SDA) infrastructures
* Experience as a remote worker demonstrating time management and self discipline with cultural change management and Agile mindset.


**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**  

The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to do the following:
* If remote, maintain home workspace in a safe manner, free from safety hazards and in line with information security policies.
* Communicate verbally in person, over the phone or by video chat and clearly/succinctly in writing, primarily utilizing a keyboard.
* Appear on camera for meetings with co-workers and government partners via video chat and ensure the protection of proprietary company and customer information is consistent with the company’s expectation of information security.
* Viewing computer screens and sitting for long periods of time.
* Travel minimally, via car or plane, which requires ability to manage luggage, laptop, and briefing materials (up to 25 pounds).

description:

title: Windows System Administrator
description:
Hi,

Greetings from Zllius Inc!

We have an urgent opening for the role**Window System Administrator.**If interested, revert me back with your Updated resume, along with contact details, work authorization.

**Job Role:** **Window System Administrator**

**Location:** **Remote**

**Duration:** **Long-Term**

**Position Type:\\*** W2\\*

**Visa:** **OPT, CPT, H1B Transfer, TN**

**Job Description:**

· The System Administrator is responsible for the overall **design, configuration, maintenance, and upgrades of SCCM / Windows / Active directory /Azure.**

· The overall objective is to ensure the systems are configured and running optimally and best serving our complex environment.

· This includes the review of the current configuration to seek improvement, create monthly deployments, and ensure our servers are properly patched each month to remain compliant and reduce vulnerabilities.

· For related projects the admin may need to develop end to end project plans including the identification of **project risks** and **risk remediation plans, project milestones, tasks**, (**WBS** - work breakdown structure), and the identification of critical path items.

· The admin may also support the **general Windows Operating System environment**, by installing, configuring, hardening, maintaining, documenting, and providing **third level OS Admin support of Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019.**

· May provide estimates of work effort and impact of projects and tasks. May design and implement multi-site **Windows Active Directory** infrastructure.

· Monitors systems to ensure platforms are available in accordance with **Service Level Agreements (SLAs).**

· Provides support to ensure that the monitoring systems are always available and that the appropriate thresholds and alerts have been set to ensure system availability.

· Reacts and responds to events in accordance with escalation procedures.

· Provides complex statistical information to management for weekly and monthly status updates, and additional information as required.

· Deploys changes in accordance with the TSYS change control process. Raises, updates and closes change control tickets in accordance with **Service Management guidelines**.

· Monitors and **reviews system logs**, detects and **troubleshoots problems**, and escalates appropriately.

· Supports issue resolution as and when required, uses the available ticketing application to record activities.

· Provides feedback and updates to the Incident resolution support teams. Investigates, troubleshoots, and provides mentoring for escalated issues.

· Conducts complex system maintenance by planning and developing strategy on **patch management,** **firmware management** and **Operating Systems upgrades** in line with best practices.

· Provides support for pre-arranged changes and maintenance events.

· Mentors less experienced team members.

· Reports and assists in investigation of **security breaches** in accordance with **Information Security guidelines.**

· Reviews and investigates any issues identified via **security monitoring applications**.

· Reviews system access in line with the required practices and procedures following **Information Security guidelines**.

· Maintains the systems responsible to the level required to meet the **HIPAA Security Standards** and other applicable industry best practices.

· Create and review the availability of **disaster recovery systems**, maintaining code, configuration and documentation in-line with Production systems.

· Perform **regular disaster recovery testing** for internal and client facing systems.

· Interacts closely with all levels of team members across business units within the company.

· Provides team members with detailed platform overview training and supporting documentation for operational, configuration, or other procedural purposes.

· Attends status calls when requested and provides detailed technical support.

· Evaluates all systems supported or maintained for potential service improvements utilizing automation and orchestrations technologies.

**Best Regards**

**Zllius Inc.**

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Remote: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Linux Administrator
description:
The Senior Systems Engineer will perform systems management in conjunction with Linux/UNIX/Windows system's administration, networking teams, application development and Internet development teams. Key activities will include system installation, OS patch management, system integration, application administration, some systems architecture and design, and system maintenance. The environment that the Systems Administrator will work within is very diverse and includes many leading-edge technologies. The server hardware is a mixture Oracle engineered systems and servers and running Solaris 10 & 11, and x86 servers running Redhat Linux & Oracle Enterprise Linux. The storage infrastructure consists of network attached storage (NAS) comprised of Oracle ZFS appliances.

### **Job Type:** **Contract to Full Time Hire**

**Location:** **100% Remote**


### **Requirements:**

* Experience implementing the following: Oracle PCA, Xsigo or Oracle Converged network and Oracle ZFS Appliance.
* Resolve common issues in Private Cloud Appliance (PCA) and ZFS appliance.
* Setup monitoring of Private Cloud Appliance and ZFS appliance
* Diagnose and troubleshoot Private Cloud Appliance and ZFS appliance
* Perform intermediate to advanced level Unix systems administration activities. Install and configure servers and other application components.
* Diagnose unique and complex system, network and application issues working closely with other IT teams.
* Installs related program products and support tools
* Install operating system patches as supplied by the vendor, as needed, in coordination with database administrator and the applications support staff.
* Virtualization - i.e. Oracle VM, VMware, Solaris LDOM, Zones
* Support tools and utilities using scripting or other programming languages to automate processes and maintain the application environments.
* Ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
* Ability to communicate technical information effectively, both orally and in writing.

**Skills Required:**

* Minimum of 6 years of experience in UNIX, and system software installation, customization, and support.
* Experience working with Solaris 10&11 and x86 servers running Redhat Linux.
* Experience with Linux mail servers running Sendmail/Postfix

  

* Experience with RedHat, and OEL
* Experience with Virtualization Technologies (OVM, OLVM, VMware, Solaris LDOM and/or Zones)

  

* Experience with Oracle VM (OVM) infrastructure

  

* Consulting experience required

 **Skills Preferred****:**

* Experience with Oracle ZFS and Oracle PCA
* Experience with Oracle Linux Virtualization (OLVM) infrastructure desired
* Experience with Oracle Hardware family (x86, SPARC and Storage)
* Experience with Apache Web Servers, Solaris, Linux patch management, Juniper switches, Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity in Unix environment.
* Working knowledge of Oracle Engineered Systems (ODA, Exalytics, Exadata) Oracle Enterprise Linux.
* Experience working with NAS or SAN storage
* General understanding of relational databases (schemas, metadata, relationships, procedures, functions, and triggers)
* Experience with PERL, shell scripting.

**Education Required:**  

**Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems, or Computer Information Systems or equivalent work experience. 6+ years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination and experience**

title: Nextech System Administrator
description:
**Job Overview:**

We are seeking a skilled and experienced professional to join our healthcare IT team as a Nextech System Administrator. The ideal candidate will play a key role in the customization and optimization of our Nextech Electronic Health Record (EHR) system, with a strong focus on template development and proficiency in SQL queries and stored procedures. This individual should be detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive in problem-solving.

**Responsibilities:**

*1. Nextech System Administration:*

* Administer and maintain the Nextech EHR system, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
* Collaborate with end-users to understand workflow requirements and customize Nextech to meet specific needs.
* Implement system upgrades and patches with minimal disruption to daily operations.

*2. Template Development:*

* Design and develop custom templates within the Nextech system to enhance user experience and streamline clinical workflows.
* Work closely with healthcare professionals to gather requirements and ensure templates align with industry best practices.

*3. SQL Query Development:*

* Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, analyze, and present data from the Nextech database.
* Create and maintain SQL stored procedures to automate routine tasks and improve data integrity.

*4. User Training and Support:*

* Provide training to end-users on Nextech system features, template usage, and best practices.
* Act as a point of contact for troubleshooting and technical support for Nextech-related issues.

*5. Documentation:*

* Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, customizations, and workflows.
* Develop and update training materials and guides for end-users.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Nextech System Administrator, with expertise in template development and SQL.
* Strong proficiency in SQL query writing and optimization.
* Experience with SQL stored procedures.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Effective communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Knowledge of healthcare industry regulations and compliance standards.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Certification in Nextech EHR administration.
* Familiarity with other healthcare IT systems and interoperability standards.
* Project management skills for overseeing system upgrades and implementations.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract
* Hourly pay

Experience level:

* 10 years

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Associate (Required)

Experience:

* SQL: 3 years (Required)
* Nextech Applications: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Azure / Systems Administrator
description:
**Azure / Systems Administrator**
  

Ligonier Ministries, a Christian non-profit organization, is seeking a talented Azure and Systems Administrator to assist the Infrastructure Services team. Infrastructure Services is responsible for Ligonier’s networks, servers, systems, software, and security.  

  

This role is primarily responsible for managing complex Azure environments. The role is also responsible for researching, deploying, provisioning, configuring, and maintaining systems and related infrastructures. Responsibilities include managing on-prem and cloud-based servers, storage, services, and business applications. The incumbent will work closely with the Infrastructure Services manager to implement information security initiatives and regulatory compliance efforts. Systems Administrators also provide end-user tech support as needed and informal mentorship to support specialists and other tech administrators.  

  

**What you bring on day one**
* Agreement with Ligonier’s General Statement of Faith.
* Love and submission to Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior.
* A vibrant Christian faith and commitment to the Church.
* 3+ years of solid experience as an Azure administrator.
* 5+ years of experience as a Microsoft 365 administrator.
* Cutting-edge industry knowledge and familiarity with a very wide range of technologies.
* Expertise leading complex tech projects independently and with cross-functional teams.
* Passion for mentoring peers and creating amazing customer experiences.
* Superb people and communication skills.

**Responsibilities include**
* Managing Entra ID, Azure servers and services, and the Microsoft 365 ecosystem.
* Planning, coordinating, and implementing security controls and measures to protect Ligonier’s identities, apps, data, and devices.
* Administering Ligonier’s email security gateway to protect users from phishing attacks and other email-based vulnerabilities.
* Serving as an MDM administrator (macOS, iPadOS, iOS, Windows, Android), continuously monitoring the health of our endpoints, and regularly conducting security and compliance audits.
* Managing and supporting user-facing IT systems and equipment, including but not limited to forensic cameras, copiers, access control, VoIP, and video conferencing setups.
* Ensuring business continuity by monitoring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems and verifying the successful completion of backups.
* Actively contributing to the documentation of SOPs and organization-wide policies.
* Working with the Data Services and Software Development Services teams to support org-wide initiatives and maintain complex data and web application infrastructure.
* Overseeing and maintaining the organization’s DNS systems and external DNS services.

**Technical qualifications**
* 5+ years recent experience as a Systems Administrator
* Experience with Azure, Microsoft 365 admin, and Google Workspace admin; AWS is a plus
* Experience working with project teams and leading medium to large technical projects
* Experience with information security and compliance standards, such as PCI DSS
* Experience implementing new tech, apps, and business process automation
* Experience managing MDM solutions for Windows and Apple devices
* Experience balancing operational and project work simultaneously
* Microsoft certifications (especially Azure) are a plus

**General qualifications**
* Communicates clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing
* Proficient in creating technical documentation and knowledge-based articles
* Serves others with outstanding customer service skills
* Driven and able to maintain focus in stressful situations
* Entrepreneurial disposition, always seeking ways to increase efficiency
* Meticulous, adaptable, and resourceful
* Exercises leadership without formal authority
* Provides technical mentorship to team members
* Strong analytical skills; superb at dealing with ambiguity
* Takes initiative and is capable of making responsible decisions
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
* Passionate about helping teammates and end users

This position is for a non-profit Christian ministry located in Sanford, FL. At this time, we are only able to hire individuals who are authorized to work in the United States.  

  

The pay range for this position is $75,000 - $90,000 annually. Pay ranges represent the lowest to highest salary we reasonably believe we would pay for this role at the time of posting. We may ultimately offer more or less than the posted range, and the ranges may be modified in the future. An employee's position within the salary range will be based on several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, geographic location, and organizational needs.

title: Systems Administrator (Windows)
description:
**Description**



The Systems Administrator is responsible for installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of hardware and software systems and the related infrastructure. This individual participates in technical research and planning to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure. Responsible for ensuring that hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values of security and cost effectiveness, while providing value to our customers.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


* Server Administration: manages physical and virtual servers, optimizing performance, patching and ensuring high availability
* Capacity Planning: Monitor system performance and resource to ensure proper performance
* Troubleshooting: Provide technical support to resolve issues, assist with escalations and assisting junior staff
* Automation and Scripting: Implement automation and scripting solutions to improve operational efficiency.
* Backup and Disaster recovery: follow backup and recovery testing schedule.
* Security and Compliance: Follow and enforce server and share access policies.
* Maintain configuration documentation, procedures, and best practices.

  


**Required Skills and Abilities**



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. In keeping with Mittera’s philosophy that each individual should be encouraged to reach his or her full potential, and in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), reasonable accommodations or modifications will be made for qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. Hours may vary depending on departmental staffing needs.

  


* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or equivalent work experience
* 2+ years’ experience in a System Administration role
* Proficiency in Windows Server administration
* Proficiency in Active Directory and Group Policy configuration
* Experience with VMWare Virtualization and VCenter
* Experience with Linux Server administration
* Experience with backup/recovery
* Scripting and automation skills (e.g. Powershell, Python)
* Excellent Communication skills
* Excellent Problem solving skills.


**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 20 pounds at times.
* Requires fine motor hand and arm movement, manual dexterity and coordination.
* + Must be able to access and navigate each department in the facility

**Physical Activity Requirements:**



Sitting (Frequent) Standing (Frequent), Walking (Frequent), Climbing (N/A), Bending (Occasional), Kneeling (Occasional), Crouching (Occasional), Grasping (N/A), Repetitive Motion (N/A)

 **DISCLAIMER**



The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of employees.

  



Newcore Technology Group does not discriminate in employment opportunities, terms and conditions of employment, or practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, gender, religious or political beliefs, national origin or heritage, disability, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Your Roles and Responsibilities:

● Monitor and manage SaaS platforms, ticket queue and end user channels.

● Accurately record all metadata related to tickets on internal tools, including, but not limited to,

CTI (category, type and item), outage resolution time, IM transcripts, postmortems, etc.

● Document runbooks for helpdesk and internal team.

● Perform change management for system changes.

● Conduct audits on each platform for administrator roles, general usage gaps, and renewals.

● Implement with excitement new SaaS applications and new features within existing applications by announcing features to the company on a regular basis.

● Create with passion training docs, videos, tips and tricks on SaaS tools for the company leading to a great collaboration experience

● Monitor user engagement metrics, collect user feedback, and adjust engagement strategies to increase adoption and ensure a positive impact on user experience.

● Use data insights to make informed decisions about tool usage and optimization.

● Collaborate with cross functional teams to merge instances of SaaS platforms for future and past acquisitions.

● Collaborate with enterprise teams to identify specific needs and use cases for collaboration tools and tailor educational content accordingly.

Required Qualifications/Skills:

● 3+ years’ experience managing enterprise collaboration tools - Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom.

● Experience with system administration tasks for configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting to maintain system health and identify fixes for end users.

● Experience working with ticket systems and following support processes.

● Solid grasp of security practices, including data management, access control, compliance audits, and vulnerability management, is critical.

● Strong communication, collaboration, and technical writing skills

● Ability to integrate collaboration tools with other systems and applications to streamline workflows through automation and scripting.

● Skills in monitoring tools and data analytics to track performance and identify areas for improvement.

● Skilled in providing excellent user support and enhancing user experience.

● Highly adaptable to change and a willingness to learn new technologies.

title: Junior System Administrator
description:
We are seeking an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Junior Enterprise Business System Administrator to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the administration of Adobe Workfront with potential to support other systems such as PandaDoc and NetSuite. The successful candidate will have strong technical skills, excellent communication, and a passion for business process improvement.  


Key Responsibilities:

* Assist platform owner to manage a software-as-a-service platform such as Adobe Workfront, including user accounts, access requests, workflows, layouts, templates, custom forms, and permissions.
* Provide technical support and training to a diverse user base.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
* Assist with new user and new customer onboarding.
* Collaborate with IT and other teams to ensure any system stability and gain approval through change management protocols
* Identify and implement process improvements to increase efficiency and effectiveness of business systems.
* Stay up to date with industry best practices, new product releases, and emerging technologies.
* Ability to prioritize and provide excellent customer service as a help desk support team member.
* Write and maintain internal and end-user functional requirements and specification documentation of business system processes, procedures, and changes.
About You

* You are a hardworking, competitive type that is driven to succeed.
* Self-starter with a reputation for being an effective change agent.
* You enjoy a challenging and a fast-paced environment where you’re encouraged to continually learn and expand on your current skillset.
Required Qualifications:

* Associate or Bachelor’s degree in communications, information systems, or related fields
* 1-2 years of experience in business system administration
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Workfront and other business systems (e.g. PandaDoc, NetSuite, Jira Service Management) is a major plus.

title: DevSecOps System Engineer/Administrator (Remote)
description:
**Spiral Solutions and Technologies, Inc. (Spiral)** is seeking a DevSecOps System Engineer/Administrator to join its team!  
**Location: Remote Work Locations**

The DevSecOps System Engineer/Administrator responsible for installing, configuring, maintaining, and monitoring all installed systems and infrastructures on the network and in a cloud infrastructure. Ensures all systems are compliant with DoD-mandated security measures, to include the RMF processes. Responsibilities also include assisting with risk identification, determining the impacts of change requests, and status reporting. In addition, the DevSecOps System Engineers/Administrator Lead will provide the team with daily taskings and periodic performance feedback.

This position is contingent upon Data for Decisions (D4D) contract award.  
Requirements:

* Comply with all policies and procedures, project plans, and industry standards, to include Spiral Solutions, Federal, State, local, DoD, and co-contractors.
* Participation in Agile Team activities is mandatory. These activities include Daily Stand-up, Sprints, Regular reviews and retrospectives, and design meetings.
* Work closely with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and Information System Security Manager (ISSM) to implement security controls on all systems that are part of the System Security Package.
* Install, configure, and maintain both Linux and Windows based operating systems, application software such as GOTS, COTS, FOSS, system management tools and patches.
* Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and work with developers to implement those fixes.
* Analyzes and resolves issues, gathers information to identify needs, evaluates systems and network requirements, and diagnoses and resolves complex software, server, and networking issues.
* Maintain security, backup, and redundancy strategies wherever possible.
* Supports, troubleshoots, repairs, and maintains server issues and security for local, development, enterprise and small to large-scale applications.
* Coordinate with 55 ISS, 55 CS, 645 AESS, L3Harris, and other co-contract personnel regarding the delivery of systems and software. Represents SST in all meetings and provides updates to the Program Manager immediately.

NOTE: You must not commit to any timelines\\work until it is discussed with the PM.

* Assists in creating scripts to monitor systems, diagnostics, resolve issues, automate routine tasks.
* Installs server hardware and components such as disks, memory, and other components, models and tests changes to production systems.
* Creates and maintains written and verbal procedures; prepares written technical documentation, training material, standards, reports, and other documents as assigned or requested by the Program Manager.
* Evaluates systems and alternate solutions; develops functional specifications, standard.
* s, and requirements for hardware and software purchase and design to ensure optimum system and end-user performance; makes recommendations for changes and additional services.
* Provides general networking, computer, and other technology training and support as needed.
* Prepares and maintains a variety of records and reports related to assigned activities; provide special reports as requested by the AIP Program Manager or host agency.
* Operates a variety of office equipment including computers, printers, and assigned software.
* Collaborate with SST employees and when directed by management, U.S. Government officials and co-contractors to design and implement features.
* Incorporate continuous education to improve skill sets and to integrate new emerging technologies in all projects. This includes studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques and computing equipment.

participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks and participate in professional organizations.

* Attention to detail is essential and all tasks must be carried out to the highest standard.
* Assess opportunities for application and process improvement and prepare documentation of rationale to share with AIP team members and other affected parties.
* Work independently when required.

**Education and Experience:**N/A

*Home | Spiral Solutions & Technologies, Inc. (ssandtech.com)*

* Background check (including credit check) and drug screen, required
* Must be eligible for a Common Access Card (CAC)
* United States citizenship, required

*Spiral Solutions and Technologies, Inc. (Spiral) complies with provisions of the EEO and ADA laws. Spiral is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*
